loans.name: Mahkam

texts.en:
Mahkam I.  is a 67 years old married man and has 4 adult children. Mahkam is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults. Mahkam is an experienced farmer that grows grapes. After gathering his yield, Mankham dries them and sells them at the market. Each year Mahkam increases the crop yield and is sufficient for family consumption and for selling. The business is the main source of income for the family.  Mahkam needs to purchase mineral fertilizer for the upcoming season and is requesting a loan  of 3200 Somoni ($ 925 USD). The loan will be repaid in 12 repayments over 11 months. Mahkam and his family are counting on your help.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they offer.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Gema Daly

texts.es:
Gema Daly V. F. tiene la edad de 25 años, su estado civil es casada esta Joven emprendedora no tiene hijos, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio ya que anteriormente había tenido la experiencia de poseer este negocio pero debido a la situación económica su negocio decayó por lo que ahora sus propósitos son de mantenerlo activo realizando promociones en la venta de su ropa, sus deseos son de superarse en la vida ya que recientemente cursa el ultimo año de su carrera por lo cual quiere luchar para conseguir esa meta por que la situación en el país esta difícil y ella desea que cuando logre tener sus hijos estos puedan tener un buen lugar donde estudiar y vivir y una base  económica sólida, sus sueños son ser una gran empresaria que genere trabajo dentro de su país e influya económicamente a nivel nacional ya que es uno de los sueños que le gustaría realizar para  que el país pueda progresar y así los estudiantes tengan la confianza de poder desarrollarse en el ámbito profesional.

La actividad económica de la Joven  Gema es la venta de ropa usada y cosméticos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Gema dio inicio a esta actividad económica con le objetivo de financiarse sus estudios universitarios, con la ayuda de su Mama quien realizo un préstamo a Fundación León 2000 ella logro el financiamiento para el comienzo de este negocio, y desde entonces ha tratado de mantenerlo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ya que algunas veces su estudio no permitía atenderlo de forma total, al principio fue muy duro ya que no tenia muchos clientes ya que no tenia muchas opciones que ofrecer y además de esto tenia que superar la crisis por la que atravesaba su familia sin embargo algunas veces tenia que salir a vender de manera ambulante pero cuando logro obtener clientes suficientes su negocio empezó a fructificar y es esta la razón por la que decide solicitar un financiamiento propuesto para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de sus productos por cajas además tiene que viajar hasta Managua y Chinandega por tanto es aquí donde le resulta mas favorable realizar las compras.
texts.en:
Gema Daly V. F. is 25 years old and married. This young entrepreneur has no children. Her life has been spent working for herself, and her intentions are to support her business. Previously, she had the experience to own this business but due to the economic situation her business declined; now her intentions are to keep promoting the sale of her clothes. Her goals are to improve herself in life and she recently studied in the last year of her career, for she wants to fight to achieve that goal, as the situation in the country is difficult and she wants to have children who can have a good place to study and live and a solid economic base. Her dreams are to be a great entrepreneur who generates income inside her country and have an economic influence at the national level. It is one of her dreams that she would like to make the country progress and that students can have the confidence to develop their personal ambition. Young Gema's economic activity is selling used clothes and cosmetics. She has owned her business for four years, and it is located in her house. Gema started this activity with the objective of financing her university studies. With the help of her mother she received a loan from Fundacion Leon in 2000; she achieved the financing to start this business, and has since tried to maintain it, with much effort and sacrifice. Some times her studies would not allow her to give it complete attention; it was very difficult in the beginning and she did not have many clients or many options to offer them, and moreover she had to overcome the crisis facing her family, and some times she had to leave to sell on the street. However, when she obtained enough clients, her business became fruitful and this is the reason she decided to ask for financing for working capital, as she has to buy her products by the box, and moreover she has to travel to Managua and Chinandega, for that is where it is most favorable to make her purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: Osas O. is a 36-year-old single man.  To earn a living, he sells spare motor parts.  He is hoping to expand his business, so he is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase additional motor parts for resale purposes.  He thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional spare motor parts

loans.name: Wobuibé

texts.fr: Mme Wobuibé E. est née le 31 Décembre 1975 à Atakpamé. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de sachets et sacs en plastique, activité qui lui permet de faire face aux charges de sa famille. Toutefois elle ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour mener à bien son activité commerciale. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de donner un nouvel élan à sa vie sur le plan économique et social.
texts.en:
Ms. Wobuibé E. was born on December 31, 1975 in Atakpamé. She is married and the mother of three. She sells plastic packets and bags that is a business enabling her to cope with family expenses. However, she lacks sufficient financial means for carrying out her commerce. She's therefore requesting financing to supply herself with merchandise to provide a boost to the economic and societal aspects of her life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell plastic packets and bags

loans.name: Maele

texts.en: Maele P. is 30 years old and married with 2 children.  She has 5 years experience in the Taro plantation business. She sells to the people of her village and at the market place 2 days per week. She had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala ($48 USD).  SPBD loans are Maele’s only access to capital as she is unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks

loans.use: To purchase timber, iron roofing,and nails to improve the house and for further improvement of the business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
“The key to success lies in our own hands and that God will always be with us if we seek His guidance,” says Corazon S.. Corazon is a simple seamstress married to Rogelio, a farmer. The couple live in San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela and are blessed with six children: Melia, 36; Lenila, 34; Jovelyn, 30; Clarita, 28; Glory, 26, and Rogelio Jr., 24. Her children were not able to pursue their college education but she is thankful that they became responsible parents and strive hard for their own families.

Corazon is an all-around sewer. She sews curtains, pants and school uniforms and she also accepts repairs and cuttings. Her business is just situated in their house. She is planning to purchase another sewing machine so she can do her work faster. For this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000.00. She wishes that her business will continue to grow more and be able to meet the needs of their family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
La señora Maximina G. muy esforzadamente se dedica a su trabajo de elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son elaboradas por ella misma con la más alta calidad atrayendo a sus clientes a diario que les gusta mucho consumir estas tortillas elaboradas por ella. 

Hoy en día ella espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas para la compra del maíz y la leña y de esta manera salir adelante en su actividad en la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maximina G. sets herself strongly to her work of the production and sale of tortillas which are made by her with the highest quality, daily attracting her customers who very much like to eat her tortillas.

Today she trustingly hopes that Ceprodel will provide her a loan to purchase premium ingredients for the production of the tortillas, to purchase corn and firewood, and thereby get ahead in her business in the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of premium ingredients

loans.name: Mirtha Beatriz

texts.en:
Mrs. Mirtha V. is 43 years old, is separated, and has one older son that loans his services for a private company.

Ten years ago Mirtha started her business selling cakes, brownies and other pastries among other items in a mini-super market. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, this has grown to be a large grocery store.

She thanks the Foundation for their support.

loans.use: The purchase of materials to make bakery goods (breads, dairy products and meats)

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is twenty-seven years old, married, and has given birth to two children: a boy and a girl. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a fitting mechanic while she is a seamstress by profession.

Comfort designs and sews for clients and also for sale. She has her workshop on the street in her community. She says at the moment, she has three apprentices under training. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1611050370), a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc, is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, H. raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this enterprise for over nine years, earning approximately 3500000 VND a month.

In 2005, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to purchase breeding livestock, H. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be her fifth from TYM Fund, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel M. de 47 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad vive solamente con su esposa Doña Ana de 48 años quien es comerciante. Samuel posee un negocio en su casa se trata de un tienda de productos de consumo de primera necesidad donde los comercializa al detalle y también por mayoreo, Samuel solicita un crédito ya que por vender al por mayor necesita mayores cantidades en productos y en esta ocasión desea surtir de aceite para cocina, cereales y otros. Samuel ya ha obtenido créditos anteriormente los cuales se encuentran cancelados  y se califica como un cliente responsable en todos sus pagos.
texts.en:
Samuel M., 47, lives in the La Libertad department. He lives with his 48 year old wife, Ana. She is a merchant. Samuel has a store in his house. He sells daily basic needs products that are consumed daily. He sells retail and also for wholesale. Samuel is asking for a loan because selling wholesale requires a greater quantity of products. He wants to stock his store with cooking oil, cereal, and other things. Samuel has had previous loans, which have been paid back. He qualifies as a responsible client in all of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 25 years old and the father of one child. He makes a living running a tent-making business in the Gikomba Market in Nairobi and has applied for his first loan, for $525, to buy polythene which he will use to make tents. He hopes that this loan will help raise his income and allow him to improve his family's living standards and meet his financial obligations. One day, Bernard wants to buy a plot of land and build his own home. He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. It recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make new tents

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay J. is from the village of Layawan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Jay is single and has one school-age child. To make a living, Jay operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Jay has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jay joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jay is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jay from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kristel

texts.es:
Kristel es una joven  soltera, carismática y trabajadora, tiene 20 años de edad, es estudiante de la facultad de  Derecho de la  Universidad Nacional de Ucayali,  se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, pues trae de Lima la mercadería y la vende a sus amistades. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace un año. Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en su negocio de compra de carteras. 
Con este préstamo es de 1000 soles, comprará prendas de vestir y accesorios como correas para damas, pulseras y otros. Su meta es terminar su carrera y obtener su titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Kristel is a charismatic, hardworking young woman. At 20 years old she studies in the faculty of Law in the National University of Icayali and sells items of clothing to her friends that she brings from Lima. She is supported by her mother and has been a member of the community bank “Las Heroínas” (the Heroines) for one year. She began with a loan of 300 soles that allowed her to invest in her business by purchasing wallets. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy articles of clothing and accessories such as belts for women, bracelets and other items. Her goal is to finish her course and obtain a university title.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of items of clothing and accessories

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una mujer  trabajadora y activa de 49 años de edad, es madre de ocho hijos, de los cuales siete son mayores de edad e independientes y uno menor de edad, ella tiene un kiosco en el puerto de Pucallpa, donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y sus principales clientes son las personas que viajan, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es agricultor, pues tiene parcelas de granos (maíz,arroz,frejol). Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Marko Jara” desde hace un  año y medio, empezó con un préstamo de 500 soles que invirtió en gaseosas y golosinas.
Con este préstamo de 1000 soles, piensa invertir una parte en la compra de productos como abarrotes en general y otra parte invertirá en la construcción de otro kiosco. La meta de Graciela es tener una tienda bien surtida de productos y seguir apoyando en su familia.
texts.en:
Graciela is an active, hardworking, woman of 49. She is also the mother of eight children, only one of which is a minor. Graciela has a kiosk in Pucallpa’s port where she sells products to meet basic needs. Her main clients are travelers. Graciela’s husband, a farmer, helps her with her work. He has fields planted with grains like corn, rice, and beans. Graciela has been a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras de Marko Jara” for a year and a half. She started with a loan of 500 soles that she invested in sodas and sweets. Graciela plans to invest part of this loan (of 1000 soles) in the purchase of general groceries items and also in the construction of another kiosk. Graciela’s goal is to have a well-stocked store and to continue to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the construction of another kiosk.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 63 años, es viudo y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde niño ha estado dedicado a las tareas del campo, sus padres fueron sus principales mentores en estas tareas y toda su vida la ha consagrado a esta labor. Es así que día a día se sigue esforzando en la siembra y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas, además de criar animales que vende los fines de semana en una feria ganadera cercana a su comunidad. Además, Pablo cuenta con el apoyo de sus dos hijos, quienes viven con él.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, él está muy contento de tener un banco comunal porque siente que es parte de un grupo humano muy fraterno. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ganado ovino y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Pablo is 63 years old, is widowed, and lives with his two children in his own home. Since he was young he has worked in farming - his parents were his primary mentors for this work, and he has dedicated himself to this work his whole life. Thus, day after day, he continues the labor of planting and harvesting his agricultural products and that of raising animals to sell on weekends at a livestock fair close to his community. In addition, Pablo relies on the help of his two children who live with him. This is his first loan from MFP, and he is very happy to be part of a communal bank because he feels like he is part of a fraternal and humane group. He will invest the money he is soliciting in the purchase of sheep and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and more animals

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustin  es casado, trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 8 años, tiene 2 hijos: la mayor tiene 14 años de edad estudia su 4to año de educaciòn secundaria, el otro niño tiene  12 años de edad estudia  su 5to grado de educaciòn primaria, esta solicitando su 2do credito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en construcciòn de  una habitación para asi tener mas comodidad en el hogar, su esposa labora como conserje del Hospital Jacinto Hernàndez, y le ayuda a su marido con los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos con AFODENIC, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos se caracterizan por ser muy responsables y humildes,  su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita.
texts.en:
Agustin is married. He has worked as a security guard for eight years. He has two children. The oldest is 14 and is in her fourth year of secondary education. The other is 12 and is in the fifth grade of elementary school. He is asking Afodenic for his second loan to build a room to make his home more comfortable. His wife works as a custodian at the Jacinto Hernández Hospital. She helps her husband with the household expenses and with the commitments with Afondenic. In spite of being a family with scant economic resources, they are characterized as being very responsible and humble. His dream is to have health, work, and a nice home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Naïmatou

texts.fr: B. Naïmatou est née en 1954 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Naïmatou réside au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou il y a de cela 50 ans. Mariée à ADE Jean-Claude, un agent à la SOBEMAP au Bénin, Naïmatou est mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Naïmatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les dépenses de la famille son supportées ensemble par le couple. Naïmatou a arrêté très tôt l'école, et depuis une vingtaine d'année, elle vend des divers (conserves, savons, bombons, biscuits, galettes d'arachide, farine de manioc, sucre, condiments de sauce, etc.) à son domicile. Naïmatou fait ses emplettes à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d'agrandir le volume de son activité et de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Naïmatou sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé. Naïmatou envisage plus tard acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Naïmatou B. was born in 1954 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's been residing in the Gbégamey neighborhood in Cotonou for fifty years and she's married to Jean-Claude ADE, a SOBEMAP (Benin port handling company) employee. Naïmatou is the mother of two children, of whom one attends school. She lives with her children and her husband. Both she and her husband support the family. She dropped out of school early on, and for about twenty years, she's been selling various items (canned food, soaps, candies, biscuits, peanut cookies, cassava flour, sugar, sauce condiments, etc) at her house. Naïmatou gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market place in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who previously benefited from two loans which were repaid without problems. In order to bolster her business and meet an ever-increasing customer demand, she's seeking a third loan from Alidé. Later, she envisions buying a plot of land.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (canned food, soaps, candies, biscuits, peanut cookies, cassava flour, sugar)

loans.name: Ka

texts.en: Ka N., 34, is a married woman and the mother of four school-aged children. To earn a living, she retails fish that she buys in bulk and normally earns $4 per day. Ka N. and her husband always quickly wake up in the morning to go where there are many fishermen, to buy fish, and then bring them to sell at retail at the market. Ka N. said that she faces a big problem with transportation because her vehicle has broken down, which affects her ability to transport her fish to the market. Therefore, she decided to look for a loan to buy a new vehicle to replace the old broken one.

loans.use: To replace a broken vehicle

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma T. is a 44-year old married woman who lives in the village of Cabunggahan, Fabrica Sagay City Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in ambulant vending of used clothes. Alma's husband helps her in running the business, they have 3 children who are school age: 1 in high school and 2 in the elementary level.

Alma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in ambulant vending of used clothing. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000 from her business activities.

Alma is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund operations of her ambulant vending business, and it has a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 19th cycle loan, the amount of Php 28,500, which she intends to use on her ambulant vending business. Alma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani S. is a 25-year-old young man and has been the owner of a general goods store in Anzeh, Jineen, for the last four years. This is in addition to his job in the security branch of the Palestinian National Authority.

Since Hani has a good number of customers and has the needed experience, he is applying for a loan from FATEN in order to upgrade his store and provide his customers with new types of goods.

This loan will help Hani to have better living conditions as well as a better income which will help him to get married and start his own family, as he is planning to do.

Hani appears in the photo at his store.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his store

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em H., 40, is married and lives with her five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Em H. raises chickens and pigs, earning US $3 per day to help support the family. The family is also supported by her husband who helps her raise the animals at home, earning US $3 per day. 

Em H. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as cover the necessary daily expenses. Em H. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more pigs and wood to build a pig cage. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy pigs and wood to build a pig cage

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.es:
La señora Merlinda es una persona joven que se dedicaba a la venta de comida pero dejó esta actividad ya que ella estaba terminado sus estudios de la universidad como odontóloga. Después de dejar la venta de comida compró un minibus y actualmente ella y su esposo, el señor Santos, tienen dos minibuses. Santos maneja uno de los minibuses y el otro trabaja con chofer, de este último Merlinda recibe una renta diara. Ahora los minibuses que ellos tienen trabajan en el Sindicato Simon Bolivar, un sindicato muy importante y reconocido en la ciudad. Merlinda y Santos son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables. El crédito que ellos solicitan es para la reparación del motor y compra de caja de cambios para uno de los minibuses.

Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Merlinda is a young woman who used to make a living by selling food, but she quit that activity since she was finishing her college studies to be a dental surgeon. After she stopped selling food, she purchased a minibus, and currently she and her husband, Santos, have two minibuses. Santos drives one of the minibuses, and the other is used for chaffeuring, for which Merlinda receives daily rent. Now their minibuses are used in the Sindicato Simon Bolivar, a very important and well known union in the city. Merlinda and Santos are very hardworking and responsible people. The credit that they are requesting is for the repair of the motor and purchase of a gearbox for one of the minibuses. They are very appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to them through this loan grant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the motor of and purchase a gearbox for their minibus

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan N. is living in the Kampong Chhnang province. She currently earns a living by cultivating rice crops. She was married but divorced her husband maN. years ago. She now has four children; one is single and the other three are married and have started new homes. One of her daughters works in the garment industry and provides little proceeds to meet her family expenses. 

Chan N. has a piece of soil that is not of good quality to plant rice. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will pay the bill for irrigating her crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the bill for irrigating her crop

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis. She is 47 years old. Cecilia is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Cecilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha W. is a 38-year old businesswoman. She is married to Raphael Ndeche, a land surveyor. Together they have three children aged 15, 11, and 4, who are in their primary school level of education. They live in the Maraba area of Kakamega. 

Martha runs a computer services business offering printing, typing, photocopying, and related reprography. She has been in this business for three years. Martha learned of KADET through a friend who is an existing client. This is her first loan from KADET and she intends to use the money to purchase computer accessories and to repair faulty computer machines. She wants to maintain a good credit record with KADET so that she might be considered for another loan. Her wish is to get a lender through KADET to enable her to take her business to another level.

From the profits made, she aspires to buy a plot of land and construct a building to house her business.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories and repair faulty computers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is a 27-year old married woman who lives in Canlinday Barangay, Culipapa Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in a fishing and fish-vending business.

Juliet’s husband, Roldan, works as a fisherman and they have 5 young children, aged between 8 months & 7 years. The couple work hard to sustain the needs of their family, especially in preparation for the future well-being of their children. 

Juliet joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fishing and fish-vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000 from her business activities.

Juliet is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to fund operations of her fishing and fish-vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 7th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 19,500, which she intends to use on her existing fishing and fish-vending business. Juliet is working hard to achieve the dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital and repair of fishing boat.

loans.name: Señor  De Malta Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento "SR. D. MALTA " es un grupo  que se encuentra en su cuarto  ciclo, esta conformado por 11 miembros 9 mujeres y 2 varones, todos se conocen y se garantizan entre ellos, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

La Presidenta es la Sra. Betty  quien es la lider y fundadora del banco, tiene el negocio D. venta D. hamburguesas, en la Av. Zuecia zona Huayra kàsa, est zona es una D. las zonas populosas D. la ciudad D. cochabamba, Esta casada  y tiene 5 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposo es chofer asalariado y el dinero que le pagan no alcanza para el sustento D. su familia, por esta razon la señora Betty le ayuda con los gastos del hogar para asi poder sacar a su numerosa familia adelante, con el dinero del credito comprara insumos e ingredientes al por mayor para la elaboracion D. sus hamburguesas.

Como Secretaria esta la Sra. Maria quien es casada y tiene 2 hijas pequeñas   es una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas venD. comida en la zona temporal, es una persona  activa y amable con sus compañeras con el dinero del credito comprara insumos e ingredientes para la elaboracion D. sus comidas.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas que en muchos casos sacan a su familia adelante solas, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The enterprising bank "SR. D. MALTA " is in its forth cycle. The group is maD. up of eleven women and two men who all know and support each other. This group is represented by the following members: Mrs. Betty is the president. She is the leader and founder of the bank. She has a business selling hamburgers on Suecia Avenue in the Huayra kàsa neighborhood. This is one of the most populated areas of the city, Cochabamba. She is married and has five school-age children. Her husband is a salaried driver but the money he is paid is not enough to take care of his family. This is why Mrs. Betty helps him with the household bills so they can get their large family ahead. They will buy wholesale supplies and ingredients to make hamburgers with the loan money. Mrs. Maria is the group's secretary. She is married and has two small children. She is a person who is very responsible and punctual with her payments. She sells food in a temporary area and is active and nice to her companions. She will buy supplies and ingredients to make food with the loan money. All the members are responsible and dynamic people who, in many cases, get their family's ahead on their own. They are very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting them with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of Working Capital

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha T., 38, owns a medium wooden house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets and soft drinks. (Mrs. Tha T. was busy when the photo was taken so her husband is shown instead.) Tha T. sells her inventory to people who are also her nearby neighbors. 

She has been running a grocery business for a long time and earns an average of $4.40 a day. To ensure the entire family has financial stability, her husband owns a machine that he uses to supply electricity for client’s batteries for a fee. This couple now lives with two children who are going to school or to work. Tha T. is taking out her loan to increase her inventory and to buy piglets for a stall she built.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and to buy piglets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital to expand a food business

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
La señora María Elsa C. G., tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y su esposo labora como albañil, con sus 2 hijos adolecentes los cuales son estudiantes , habitan en el barrio la Francia numero dos,  ella es agricultora de piña desde hace 15 años.

Dentro de los problemas que más la agobian, esta el robo indiscriminado de las cosechas, pero solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos vegetativos y fertilizantes que permitan mejores  condiciones fitosanitarias, que favorezcan a la buena producción de las siembras, o el capital necesario para a futuro sembrar una manzana de piña que le brinde mejores condiciones socioeconómicas , o la reconstrucción de su humilde vivienda, que tanto les afana a habitar en un ambiente más optimo para todos los miembros de la familia, sobre todo que sus hijos están en una etapa de sus vidas en donde demandan de mayores condiciones e independencia de espacio para su bienestar personal.
texts.en:
María Elsa is 38 years old. She is married and her husband works as a mason. They live in the Francia 2 neighborhood and have two teen-aged children; both students. María has been a pineapple farmer for 15 years. Among the challenges she faces is the indiscriminant theft of her crops. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a greater inventory of vegetable farming supplies and fertilizer that will improve the quality of the soil and result in increased production, and to have the necessary working capital to be able to plant more pineapple that will help her create more favorable economic conditions and allow her to rebuild her humble home so that she can create better living conditions for her family. Above all, her children are now at the point in their lives where the need more personal space for their well being.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 48-year-old woman and the single mother of six children whom she looks after in a rented home in Masindi, Uganda. She says she wants to have her own residential home in the near future.

Margret sells local brew and has been doing so for the last twenty-four years now. At this stage, she wants to have a bigger and more organized place to house her pub business as she seeks to grow the business for more income for her family. Her local brew is hugely marketable for a certain tribe who cherish it so much more than any other drink.

This is Margret’s loan from HOFOKAM with which she is to buy millet for making more local brew to sell in her pub.

loans.use: To purchase millet for making more local brew to sell

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Katupyry, se conformó en julio de 2008, con mujeres muy trabajadoras en una zona poco favorecida con el desarrollo económico.
 A lo largo de los tres años que vienen obteniendo el crédito, han pasado han procurado siempre estar al día con sus cuotas.
 Este comité se encuentra en un zona que no tiene mucho movimiento comercial, por lo que las señoras deben trasladarse a otras ciudades para vendes sus productos. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Floriana quien se dedica  a las manualidades para obtener un ingreso. 
Ella realiza bordados sobre telas, vestidos, también realiza manualidades fabricando sobrecamas, manteles, y otros.
Sus clientes aprecian mucho los trabajos que ella realiza, ya que tiene una buena terminación y son muy delicados.
La familia de la señora Floriana es muy humilde y su casa necesita de algunas comodidades, por que solicita el préstamo para la comprar camas para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Description: The communal bank "Kuña Katupyry", was formed in July 2008 by hard-working women in an area not favored with economic development. During the past three years of taking out loans, they have always tried to keep up with their payments. This communal bank is in an area that does not get much business, so the women have to go to other cities to sell their products. One of the members is Mrs Floriana who makes crafts for a living. She embroiderers fabrics and clothing and also makes crafts like bedspreads, tablecloths, and other things. Her customers greatly appreciate her work because it has a good finish and is very delicate. Mrs. Floriana's family is very humble and her house is lacking in some comforts which is why she is taking out a loan -- to buy beds for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beds.

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
Langat is 32 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children, ages 2, 4 and 9. Two of the children are currently attending school. 

Langat has been operating his mixed farm for 10 years and has employed one farmhand. His farm produces pineapples, tea, bananas and milk, which he sells to the local market. He is also employed and earns a salary.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this cow will increase his milk production and he will be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption. His biggest challenges have been drought, which leads to low production, and unreliable casual laborers.

In the future, he would like to purchase motorbikes to be used in transporting farm produce to the market. He says that Juhudi loans have improved his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en: Talalelei L. is 50 and married with six children whose ages range from 13 to 35. She is starting a business venture to sell pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam). Talalelei needs a loan of 2,200 Samoan talas to buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or about $167 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2008, Talalelei joined SPBD. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Talalelei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace cinco años atrás, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, grado de instrucción primaria incompleta, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres están bajo su dependencia.
Se dedica a la venta de frazadas y llicllas (mantas) desde hace veinte años, ahora vende de lunes a sábado al por mayor y menor en La Paz - Bolivia. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo  incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles para aumentar su mercadería de llicllas.
Su visión es comprar máquinas de coser para confeccionar llicllas por cantidad en Bolivia. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los préstamos y sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Benita , 42, has been a member of the “Chojchoni” communal bank for the last 5 years. It’s located in Copani, Yunguyo province, Puno department. She’s married and has four children three of whom still depend on her. She did not complete primary school. She has sold blankets and comforters for the last 20 years. She sells both wholesale and retail in La Paz, Bolivia, from Monday through Saturday. The first loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was for 300 new soles that she used to increase her capital. She will request a new, 2000 new sol loan, to increase her supply of blankets. Her vision is to purchase sewing machines to make the blankets in quantity in Bolivia. What she most enjoys about her communal bank are the loans and her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor G. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 42 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Amor owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Amor has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Amor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amor is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Amor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María Santos Núñez es una comerciante de 38 años de edad, casada y con cinco hijos, residente en la comunidad de las Américas en Patuca, Olancho. Doña María es una persona muy humilde que inició hace dieciocho años a ganarse la vida con una chiclera pero poco a poco sus necesidades y las de su familia fueron creciendo y entonces tuvo la idea de instalar una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y como en ese momento no contaba con dinero disponible solicitó un préstamo en FAMA y con el apoyo recibido pudo hacerlo. Ahora ella tiene su negocio bien surtido y lo atiende desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos necesarios para la dieta alimenticia de las familias, como ser arroz, lácteos, verduras, frijoles, maíz, lácteos, embutidos, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo su negocio seguirá en marcha y podrá seguir sosteniendo a su familia.  Su meta es tener un negocio más grande y que las condiciones de su vida y la de su familia mejoren. Es su quinto ciclo en FAMA y es muy puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en: Maria Santos Núñez is a 38 year old shopkeeper, married with five children, living in the community of the Americas in Patuca, Olancho. Ms. Maria is a very humble person, who started eighteen years ago to earn a living selling gum, but gradually her needs and those of her family were growing and she then had the idea of installing a small store in her home.  Because at that time she had no money available, she asked for a loan from FAMA and with that support she could do it. Now she has a well-stocked business and is open from 6:00 am until 9:00 pm. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of items needed for a basic family diet, such as rice, vegetables, beans, corn, dairy, meats, etc. With the support of the loan she will continue to run her business and continue supporting her family. Her goal is to have a larger business and that the conditions of her life and family will improve. This is her fifth loan from FAMA and she is very punctual in her payments.

loans.use: increase inventory

loans.name: Devora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Devora está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Rosa Argentina L. G. de 30 años quien se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace cinco años con la ayuda de su madre y con el fin de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Mayra Carolina G. Soza de 40 años quien tiene un cafetín desde hace 8 años negocio que inicio con poco y que gracias a los créditos ha mejorado y Yareth del Concepción L. quien se dedica a la venta de repuesto de bicicleta desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
The Devora group is comprised of three hardworking women, one of whom is Rosa Argentina L. G. who is 30 years old and who has been selling shoes since five years ago with the help of her mom so that she can give her daughter a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are Mayra Carolina G. Soza, 40 years old, who has had a coffee shop for eight years that she started with very little, and thanks to the loans, has improved, and Yareth del Concepción L. who has been selling bicycle replacement parts for five years.

loans.use: Footwear

loans.name: Edgar Armando

texts.es:
Edgar C. tiene 30 años, lleva 10 años de casado y tiene cuatro hijos los dos mayores van al colegio.

Su negocio lo inicio hace 4 años y es de venta de electrodomésticos y se llama comercial J Y J, tiene 3 empleados que le ayudan a distribuir su mercadería y a cobrar lo vendido. El préstamo que el solicita es para comprar mercadería variada tales como colchas, licuadoras, vajillas, cortinas.

El sueño de Don Edgar es incrementar su negocio, obtener mas ganancias y darles un mejor futuro a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Edgar C. is 30 years old. He has been married for ten years and has four children, the two older of which are in high school.

He started his business selling household appliances four years ago and it is called J and J Stores. He has three employees that help him to distribute merchandise and charge what is sold. The loan that he is requesting is to purchase various merchandise such as bedspreads, blenders, dishes, curtains, etc.

Edgar’s dream is to expand his business, earn more, and provide his wife and children with a better future.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; tiene 50 años de edad, y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos naturales llamada Herbalife que vende en forma independiente y también lo vende con su hija y lo llevan a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al público en general, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los productos naturales. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de naturales al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Gloria is 50 years old.  She is a widow and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling natural products called Herbalife.  She sells independently and also sells with her daughter.  They take their products to different places such as institutions and the general public.  She would like to have a store where she can sell natural products.  She is requesting this loan to buy natural products wholesale.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy natural products wholesale

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn C. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 44 years old. Novelyn is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Novelyn owns and operates a retail business running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk food and beverages to the local community. Novelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Novelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Novelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Novelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Novelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos dedicado al servicio de gomería ya hace años atrás con una experiencia que mantiene satisfecho a los clientes que acuden a el, este servicio lo realiza en una avenida céntrica, en la que tiene bastante afluencia de clientes, el señor tiene buenas y grandes  perspectivas para el futuro, como inaugurar otra tienda de gomería y obtener mas ingresos para poder mantener estables a toda su familia, es muy trabajador y responsable el dinero del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una compresora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Juan Carlos has been making a living for many years providing tire repair service.  He is known for maintaining his customers satisfied.  He has this service station in a central avenue where he gets many customers to come in.  His plans for the future are good and large, such as opening another tire shop and increasing his profits to be able to provide a stable support for his family.  He is very hard working and responsible.  The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of a compressor.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support that he has received.

loans.use: Purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 30 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gilda de 24 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. A lo largo de su vida, Cesar ha trabajado en muchas cosas, ahora se decida al trabajo de la albañilería y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos y es que cuando hay que levantar una pared en su barrio de la ciudad de Kimbiri, él es el albañil con más experiencia, al que todos recurren. Cesar disfruta de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con esta digna profesión puede pagar la educación de sus hijos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta profesión y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que ha hecho que sus manos envejezcan rápidamente. Pero su pronto requerimiento es renovar sus herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para realizar más trabajos de construcción, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará tablones nuevos y aumentará su número de puntales, con lo cual podrá trabajar en más construcciones a la vez y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 30, is a kind and hard working man. He lives in his own house with his wife Gilda, age 24, and their beloved children, to whom they hope to provide a better future.
 
For most of his life Cesar has done different kinds of work, but he is now dedicated to his work in construction. His work is in high demand by all of his neighbors; whenever someone needs a wall built in Cesar's neighborhood in Kimbiri city, he is the one everyone turns to because he has the most experience. 

Cesar enjoys working in construction; it is a decent profession that allows him to pay for his children's education. He has been working in construction for 10 years and thinks the most difficult part of his work is loading the heavy bricks and handling cement by hand. This prematurely ages his hands. But his greatest priority is to upgrade his tools to improve his work. This is Cesar's first loan from MFP and he doesn't want to risk running out of money to repay it, so he is currently making contacts for more construction work. He is the only man in his community bank, so he always makes an effort to be responsible and respectful towards all the other members. 

With the 1,000 PEN loan, Cesar will buy new wooden planks and more posts, construction materials that will allow him to work on more jobs at the same time and thus increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase wooden planks for construction business.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in his son in law's fence. His oldest daughter works as a teacher for the local school in Erdenetsagaan subprovince while his middle son works as a salesperson in the local grocery shop. His youngest son attends a local vocational training in a computer class. His wife has been operating a sewing business out of her home where she sews a variety of traditional clothing items, since 2000. Batbold operates a meat trading business. He started his business in 2006 and has gained a lot of experience.  For the future, he plans to have his own plot of land and fence for his family. He will use this loan to purchase a large amount of meat to sell in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia for profits. With his business earnings, he hopes to purchase timbers and woods from Ulaanbaatar to build a fence in his own land which was given by the government. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to use as he planned.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio M. lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has 13 years experience as a farmer. He aims to increase his harvest so that he can afford the basic needs of the family. 

He would like to apply for a loan at CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, chemicals and rice seeds. Through this, he believes he will be able to increase his harvest.

Dionesio is 51 years old and a father to six children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals and rice seeds

loans.name: Essumaba Adjoa

texts.en: Essumaba Adjoa B. has been a petty trader for several years, selling an assortment of items such as baby’s diapers, clothes and bags, in Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. She carries her wares to neighboring villages, usually an hour’s walk or more, to sell. She and her husband, a farmer, have three children. Essumaba's income helps pay for their children’s education and for some of the household expenses. Essumaba hopes to develop her business and set up her own store one day. A loan will help her purchase a greater variety of items for sale. The extra profits will be reinvested in her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of clothes

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Mario; el tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio es agricultor lleva años en esta actividad el cual le brinda muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas y personales, sus cosechas lo lleva  a las distintas ferias que se realizan en el Valle Sagrado y los mercados de Cusco como el mercado de Huancaro, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja llevan años en esta actividad y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Mario is 29 years old, lives with his partner, and has one child.  He is a farmer and has been in this line of work for years.  His work brings him a lot of financial and personal satisfaction.  He sells his crops in markets in the Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley) and also markets in Cusco such as Huancaro Market.  Mario works together with his partner.  They have been in this business for years and it is how they get their family ahead in life.

Mario is requesting this loan to buy seeds for his farm.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds for his farm

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Teo has two businesses selling African clothing and selling chapats, or flat bread. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days a week. Teo sells her products from home. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell, as well as threads, a bag of charcoal, and cooking oil.   

The main business challenge for Teo is seasonality. Her goal is to build her own house. Teo lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Rosenia

texts.en:
Rosenia B. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Rosenia is single and has one school-aged child. Rosenia owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal services (motorcycle transport) to local community members. Rosenia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Rosenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 17,000 PHP and was used to purchase tools needed to provide service.

Rosenia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca Blanca que se ubica a 12 km del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí  ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 3años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido ayudar a  mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de aves de corral.

Gladis desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, asimismo compra de animales para incrementar su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gladis is 50 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the small town of Huaca Blanca. This is located 12 km from the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the region of Lambayeque.

She has a small grocery store in her home. She sells to her neighbors a variety of products, such as basic products and groceries. The business is 3 years old and has an established and loyal client base. Thanks to this business she has been able to support her family and help them get ahead. She also sells poultry. 

Gladis would like to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. She would also like to buy animals to increase her business. In order to do this, she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of PEN 1,500.00.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing L., 36, resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. L. sells groceries, earning an income of $5 USD per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of $7 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $85 USD on food and $35 USD on other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase more goods for her husband to expand his construction business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more goods to expand the construction business

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn E. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Madelyn owns and operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. Madelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Madelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials such as nail polish and cuticle remover. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Madelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as nail polish and cuticle remover

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 39 years old and married with four children, the oldest being 15. Mildred and her husband are both farmers. They till their own land located in Banga, South Cotabato where they grow rice and corn crops to sell. Mildred also raises pigs in their backyard and does her best to help sustain her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pig feed. She is hopeful that this loan will help her businesses grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and one child. He has owned a small grocery store since 1998, where he sells dairy and daily products, detergents, etc.  He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. He cooperates with his wife who works in a local company in order to earn a good income and to have a good standard of living.

He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been an excellent client with payments on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by enlarging his shop and adding home products to his inventory.

loans.use: increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a farmer and a tricycle operator. Marites is a farmer working in the Philippines. She has been growing corn for 22 years. 

Marites is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos to purchase fertilizers (like manure) and seeds of corn to be planted in her farm. She wants to maintain her agricultural business for the future of her family. Getting high yields and income are her desires to attain her daughter's wish of going abroad to help them uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 56 year-old married lady with grown children.  She has been practicing dairy farming for three years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances.  This has helped her in saving and investing more in her business.  

She hopes to own a ranch in the future.  She wants to start raising pigs.  For this reason, she has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Laura Imelda

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal Sentimiento, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, por un sector muy visitado gracias a su buena gastronomía, su hermosa arquitectura, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, su mayor característica es la de ser personas muy cálidas y amables.

La Señora. Laura tiene 44 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 24, 23, 18 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su tercera estudia en la universidad.  La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña Laura se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Forever, también vende ropa, joyas y realiza bufetes, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su vecina, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales, ropa y joyas para seguir creciendo en sus negocios.

Su meta es ponerse una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laura is a member of the “Sentimiento” (Feelings) Community Bank. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. It is a place that is visited a lot, thanks to its good food, beautiful architecture, business people, farm animals and agriculture. The area’s best feature is the warm and friendly people.
Mrs. Laura is 44 years old, and a widow. In her marriage she had four children, ages 24, 23, 18 and 3. The oldest two children are married and independent. The third child is studying at the university. She owns her house.
Mrs. Laura sells natural care products called “Forever”. She also sells clothes, jewelry and office supplies. She works from Sunday to Sunday but she doesn’t have fixed work hours. This is her first loan with the community bank. She was invited to join this bank by her neighbor. This loan she will use to buy natural products, clothes and jewelry in order to grow her business.
Her goal is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: to buy natural products, clothes and jewelry. .

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 61 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Editha is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Editha has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He has been employed in a locA. company since 2009 where he operates as a security agent. In parallel, he has been working as a freelance carpenter since 1990, serving clients upon their request. He works hard to provide a better life for his family. Today, due to his limited income, Ibrahim is requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his son's education fees before the beginning of the new school year.  This borrower’s main purpose in life is to insure a good education level for his son until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay his son's education fees

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou est une jeune femme de 22 ans qui vient de se marier il y a quatre mois avec son chérie qui est comptable à la Chambre de Commerce. Ils habitent ensemble dans une grande ville dans le sud du Sénégal, pas loin de la mer.
Elle est en train de monter son activité dans le commerce et elle a eu l’idée d’acheter un congélateur pour le commerce de la glace et les jus de fruits. La glace est toujours rechercher dans cette zone du Sénégal parce qu’il fait chaud toute l’année mais surtout actuellement pendant la saison des pluies. Elle achète aussi les vêtements pour faire des batiks qu’elle envoie à Dakar pour la commercialisation.
 Cette jeune femme courageuse souhaite l’appui de l’UIMCEC et de Kiva pour l’aider à diversifier son activité et pour avoir un revenue personnelle.
texts.en: Aissatou is a 22-year-old young woman who just got married four months ago to her darling, an accountant at the Chamber of Commerce. They live together in a large city in southern Senegal and not far from the sea. Right now, she is setting up her business, and she had the idea to buy a freezer for her business of making ice and fruit juices. Ice is always in demand in this area of Senegal because the weather is warm all year long, but especially now during the rainy season. Aissatou also buys clothing for making batiks, which she sends to Dakar to be marketed. This brave young woman would like support from the micro-finance institution UIMCEC and from Kiva to help her to diversify her business and to have her own income.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for making ice for resale and to buy clothing for making batiks

loans.name: Efrenor

texts.en:
Efrenor describes himself as an ambitious person. He keeps dreaming for a better quality of life someday. Aside from his hog raising business, he works hard all day long in his rice field.
