He cultivates a half-hectare plot of land. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to local traders in the village where he lives together with his wife and three children. He earned about 30,000 PHP during the last cropping season in May and used it for paying electric bills, grocery items for daily meals and allowances for his children.

Efrenor is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP because he has insufficient capital to buy seeds and herbicides (chemicals used to kill growth of unwanted plants like weeds that affect growth of seedlings) necessary in farming.

Efrenor would like to continuously harvest abundant crops to save enough money in preparation for the college education of his three children. He wants them to have a degree and good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, vive con sus padres, es soltero, se dedica a la agricultura: maíz y frijoles trabaja con su padre, todos los días, no tiene un horario establecido.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar herbicidas para las plagas, abono y sobre todo semilla para sembrar y de esa forma obtener más ingresos para venderlo y dejar para su familia.
El sueño de José es hacer su propia casa, comprar un terreno y sembrar café y tener una mejor estabilidad económica para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his parents and is unmarried.  He works in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  He works with his father on a daily basis, with no fixed work schedule.

He needs the loan to purchase herbicides to treat infestations, manure, and above all seeds for planting and in this way he will earn more income by selling his crops and be able to provide for his family.

José's dream is to build his own home, to buy some farmland and grow coffee, and to have better financial stability for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides to treat infestations, manure, and above all seeds.

loans.name: Dany

texts.en: Dany, 28 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province that is known for ancient temples and tourism. She and her husband are construction workers, and they earn $8 per day. Dany has two children, one in school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her family to travel to work. She has a plan to buy pigs to feed at home when she has enough money. She wants to support her children in studying at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to work

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, 46, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cleto, a jeepney driver, and the mother to their four children. Three of them are already working while the other one is in high school. By the grace of God, Rosana has managed to support her child's schooling. Rosana is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosana oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and parts for their jeepney and also to buy some equipment in their repair shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Rosana dreams that her child will finish her education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

---Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Wilma Vicenta

texts.es:
Se trata de una persona joven, soltera sin hijos que estudia y trabaja en un Hospedaje y en una Despensa, vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Pilar y es oriunda del interior específicamente de San Juan de Ñeembucu donde están sus padres que son agricultor y ganaderos.
Está cursando actualmente el primer año de la carrera de Enfermería de la Facultad. Ella comenta que su mayor anhelo es poder ayudar a las personas por medio de su trabajo, es por ello que se esfuerza diariamente.
Solicita el crédito para el pago de materiales y cuotas de sus estudios para poder rendir sus exámenes finales. Ella está muy agradecida a la institución por la oportunidad que le da por poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
This is about a young, single, childless young woman who studies and works at an inn and at a store.  She lives in a rented house in the city of Pilar.  

She’s from the interior of the country, specifically from San Juan de Ñeembucu which is where her parents, who are farmers and raise livestock, live.

She is currently in first year of Applied Nursing.  She comments that her greatest wish is to be able to help people through her work and this is why she puts such an effort in daily.

She asked for the loan to pay for supplies and fees in order to present her final exams.  She is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity it gives her to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition and to buy university supplies.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson, a 43-year-old Ugandan father of four children between the ages of 24 and 8. hails from Kyenjojo District where he has operated a retail shop for four years. He is now requesting a loan to buy fuel, soap and sugar for resale, and dreams of developing his business into a wholesale operation and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy fuel, soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen 
Comercio
500000
	Carmen ha sido una líder en la zona de Puntarenas para el apoyo de mujeres que desean superarse y salir a delante, vive en el Barrio 20 de Noviembre en Puntarenas, lugar de mucha pobreza y problemas sociales, tiene 52 años de edad y vive con sus 3 hijos y tiene un nieto. Con el esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado dar estudio a sus hijos, una de ellas es enfermera; además de agrupar mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras para apoyarlas con crédito por parte de Fundación Mujer, siendo el único ingreso de la casa. 
	El objetivo de este préstamo es comprar mercadería, como productos de catálogo y electrodomésticos, que va a comprar a un deposito libre muy conocido en la zona Sur de Costa Rica, aprovechando la época donde hay muchos ingresos por aguinaldo y ahorros y la gente desea comprar artículos ya se para regalar  o para auto regalarse, situación que la clienta, por su experiencia y conocimiento del mercado aprovecha. Carmen también perteneció al Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas que ha apoyado a otras mujeres con crédito para sus negocios.
	Entre sus metas destaca salir adelante para que sus hijos y ella tengan un futuro mejor, que puedan estudiar y apoyar a que su negocio crezca cada día más. Por ahora la dificultada más grande ha sido la económica, pero han encontrado en este programa un apoyo para su micro emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Carmen has been a leader in the Puntarenas area in supporting women who want to excel and get ahead. She lives in Barrio 20 de Noviembre in Puntarenas, a place of great poverty and many social problems. She is 52 and lives with her three children and has a grandson. Through a lot of effort and hard work she has succeeded in providing her children with an education (one of whom is now a nurse) and has also brought together hardworking and enterprising women in order to advocate for their loans from Fundación Mujer, since they are often the only income-earners in their households. 

This loan is to buy merchandise, such as catalog products and household appliances, that she is going to purchase in the duty free shopping zone, well known in the southern part of Costa Rica, and take advantage of the season when there are a lot of Christmas bonuses and savings and people want to buy items, whether to give to others or to themselves, a situation that the client, due to her experience and knowledge of the market, knows how to capitalize on.

Carmen also belonged to the Mujer Creciendo Juntas communal bank, which has supported other women with loans for their businesses.

Among her goals, getting ahead stands out, so that she and her children will have a better future; so that they can get more education and she will have support for her business to grow more each day.  For now, the greatest difficulty has been the economy; however she has found support for her small business in this program.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of catalog merchandise and small household appliances.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: El señor  Mario Alberto es un hombre trabajador dispuesto a ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida. Trabaja en una maquiladora en el día y de noche trabaja en taxi para así obtener más ingresos y así suplir los gastos del hogar. Desde hace varios años el obtuvo su casa de interés social, la cual le ha estado haciendo mejoras, este sacrificio que hace es para darles una mejor comodidad a sus 2 hijos junto con su esposa. El proyecto que el tiene es terminar de levantar una barda en la parte de frontal ya que en el crédito anterior no le fue suficiente para que quedara totalmente hecha. Solo levanto las bardas laterales que dan hacia el vecino. Para Mario es muy importante ofrecer a su familia seguridad por lo que necesita comprar material como block, cemento arena, varilla y pagar la mano de obra, de esta manera el podrá irse tranquilo a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto is a hardworking man determined to offer his family a better quality of life.  He works at an assembly plant during the day and at night drives a taxi to earn extra income and be able to meet household expenses.  

Several years ago he obtained his government-subsidized house that he’s been making improvements to. This sacrifice he makes is to provide more comfort to his wife and two children.

The project he has is to finish erecting a front wall since the previous loan didn’t quite suffice to finish the job.  He was only able to erect the lateral walls that face his neighbor.  For Mario, it’s very important to offer his family security and to do so he needs to buy materials like concrete block, cement, sand, rebar and to pay labor costs.  This way he will be able to go to work with peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy building materials to erect a wall.

loans.name: Mazvimba1 Group

texts.en:
Grace is 53 years old, widowed and has seven children aged 34 ,30,25,23,20,17 and 14. Two of them attend school. She has three dependents who are her grandchildren. She has no other source of income.

She has been in business for 10 years and has no employees. The family helps out in the business. She buys her products from South Africa and Zambia.

She faces the challenge of debtors who fail to pay. She would like to own a shop in town and the loan would help her generate more profits to build her family home in the rural area.

loans.use: to buy lotions, fish, curtains, and satellite dishes

loans.name: Elezon

texts.en:
Elezon is a 30 year old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 12 and 4.  All of them go to school. 

Elezon runs a food store business and he has been in the business for 10 years. He has one employee.in addition to this business, Elezon has no other source of income. 

Elezon heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers’ word of mouth promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 2,500 SSP to purchase items like maize grains and many others. 

In five years time, Elezon would like to bring different types of items into his store. 

His major challenges include feeding the family, school fess and sickness. 

Elezon says that, He is appreciating finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase items like maize grains.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Lina quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que diariamente se esfuerzan por darles a sus familias lo mejor y evitar que pasen por necesidades.
La sra. Lina se dedica a la venta de frutas en general. Esta acompañada  hace 20 años con el señor Victor quien tiene una gomería, tienen cinco hijos, uno mayor de edad y cuatro menores que van a  la primaria. Lina comenta que por medio de su negocio ha podido ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa y de esa forma poder llevar juntos el hogar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser bananas, sandias, melones, uvas y demás tipos de frutas para poder abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group contact who was responsible for starting this current committee is Sra. Lina. She invited and organized her friends in order to join the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. The members are hardworking and determined women who strive on a daily basis to provide the best for their families and to avoid being in need.

Sra. Lina sells fruit. She has been married for 20 years to Sr. Victor, who owns a tire shop. They have five children, one who is grown while the other four are in school. Lina says that through her business she has been able to help her husband with the household expenses. By partnering together, they have been able to establish their home.

Lina is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as bananas, watermelons, melons, grapes, and other types of produce so that she can restock her inventory and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Renatto

texts.es:
Renatto es un joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y sobre todo tiene un don para la preparación de platillos típicos, ya que son muy deliciosos, también la ciudad de chincha posee playas hermosas y también se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a correr y en ocasiones comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa Seca”. 

Día a día Renatto trabaja  en una mina, alrededor de 8 horas al día, pero por las tardes estudia en la universidad de su ciudad la carrera de administración de empresas, asimismo tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de joyas y con el fruto de su trabajo y esfuerzo puede solventar a duras penas, los gastos de sus estudios; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene mucha ganas de salir adelante.

Renatto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar joyas, para su negocio de bijouteria en especial aretes, collares, anillos, entre otros y así poder tener más variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos y poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios; así el seguirá luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y poder tener una gran empresa”.

loans.use: Para compra de mercaderia (aretes, collares, anillos, entre otros)

loans.name: Beatrice K

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 53-year-old married, honest and hardworking woman living in Kagadi, Uganda with eight children, aged between 30 and 16 years; five attend school. 

She has been in teaching service for 32 years, as she wanted to help children and earn from farming. She hopes to educate her children up to university, though she is challenged by low pay and delayed salary. 

Beatrice thanks Hofokam for the school fees support, and is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Justine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), âgée de 34 ans ne vit plus avec son mari. Justine  est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Justine vit seule avec ses enfants. Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Depuis près de vingt ans, Justine vend du pain et des garnitures par la technique de distribution. Parallèlement à son activité, Justine vend également des plastiques ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.  C’est la première fois que Justine et les autres membres de son groupe sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des plastiques.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
BENSO est un groupe de l’association SABABOU de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente des produits cosmétique  à l’image de MAH qui est la deuxième  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUBOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente des produits cosmétique : parfums, crème à lèvre et savon.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a six ans. Elles sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire. 
MAH, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, excellente dans la vente des produits de cosmétique. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  10 cartons de parfum et 10 cartons de savon.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et OUELESSEBOUGOU auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et  réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente des produits cosmétique.

loans.use: Achat des produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply Milk storage cans and assorted veterinary products to peasant farmers.

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en: Rufo is a 45 year old mother of one son and 3 adopted children.  Her business is a coffee shop located in the capital of Samoa which is Apia.    Rufo lived most of her life in America but when her husband passed away she moved back to Samoa. She started a coffee shop business that is her main source of income in taking care of her children.  Rufo had the idea of her business from America, and she found it really successful in Samoa. She has picked a good location which is near to the main bus stop.  Her daily customers are mostly students.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her coffee shop and buy new cooking equipment - stove, coffeemaker, pots, pans, and other utensils

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca has a very well situated store, located on a main street. She started her business with the help of a $200 loan from the loan sharks. At first she only sold rice, sugar and oil. Now she continues to offer those products, along with legumes and ice cream.

Blanca will use the loan to buy additional merchandise with which to expand her store. She has every confidence that the business will grow and she will be able to continue making investments.

Blanca is the mother of 5 children and a widow. She is 35 years old. She depends entirely on her business for the income she needs to support her family. She hopes that this loan will give her financial security and permit her to save for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca tiene una tienda muy bien ubicada en una calle principal. Blanca empezó el negocio con la ayuda de un crédito que solicito a los chulqueros de 200 dólares. Al principio solo vendía arroz, azúcar y aceite. Ahora ella continúa ofreciendo estos productos junto con legumbres y helados.

Blanca usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para incrementar su tienda. Ella tiene toda la seguridad que negocio crecerá y podrá seguir haciendo inversiones.

Blanca es madre de cinco hijos, viuda, tiene 35 años. Ella depende de su negocio completamente para apoyar a su familia. Ella tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y pueda permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Najeeba

texts.en: Najeeba lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is divorced and lives with her brother. She wants to work to make a good future for herself. She is skilled at embroidery. She has experience in this craft. She wants to take a group loan to buy embroidery materials to expand her business. She wants to make a good life for herself and also for her brother. She is happy, and she would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano U. is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. She has a post-secondary education. Her husband is a salesman. Rano’s son repairs apartments and her daughter is going to school. Rano has been selling eggs for over 11 years. She started this business after the factory she worked in closed down. Rano began working with MLF “MicroInvest” in 2005. Back then, her assets were $150. After receiving her first loan and using it to grow and improve her business, Rano exchanged her point of sale for a better one, thereby increasing her sales turnover and improved her family’s standard of living. Her current assets are up to $300. In the future, she is planning to sell eggs wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Усмонова Рано- 44лет. Замужем, мать двоих детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается торговлей, старший сын занимается ремонтом квартир, дочка учиться в школе. Рано занимается продажей яиц вот уже более 11лет. Начала она заниматься этой деятельностью, после того как заводы и фабрики были закрыты, и она осталась без работы. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» начала кредитоваться в 2005 году, тогда её активы составляли 150$. После получения займа и целевого использования она поменяла место своей деятельности на более лучшее, увеличила товарооборот и улучшила уровень жизни. Сейчас её активы возросли до 300$. В будущем планирует перейти и на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Wholesale trade of eggs

loans.name: Gladys Karina

texts.es:
Gladys es una trabajadora mujer que se esfuerza día a día y agota todas sus energías para poder ofrecer sus excelentes platos de comida china a sus exigentes comensales que la visitan durante todo el día en su modesto restaurante. Esta actividad la viene desempeñando hace ya siete años y comenzó vendiendo en una pequeña carretilla siempre con la ayuda y compañía de su querido esposo, esto gracias al préstamo de su suegro. Después de tres años de éxito decidieron establecerse en un local alquilado donde ya llevan cerca de cuatro años y es así que siguen manteniendo el inmenso esfuerzo que requiere su negocio ya que les permite incrementar el número de sus clientes y generar mayores beneficios para sus pequeños hijos. Sus metas son grandes pues sueña abrir otros establecimientos de comida y se ha propuesto seguir trabajando diligentemente para lograrlo ahora aún más debido a que su esposo se encuentra delicado de salud y actualmente requiere un costoso tratamiento médico para aliviarse pronto. Gladys seguirá trabajando y es por ello que necesita un préstamo de 350 dólares que invertirá para mejorar las instalaciones su establecimiento. No pierdas esta valiosa oportunidad de colaborar con Gladys, al apoyarla también apoyarás a toda una familia.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys is a dedicated woman that works hard every day and devotes all of her energy to offering excellent Chinese food to the diners that visit her small restaurant every day. This venture began seven years ago, selling from a small cart. It was made possible by the help and company of her beloved husband and thanks to a loan from her father-in-law. After three years of success, Gladys and her husband decided to establish their business in a rented shop where they have been for nearly four years. They have continued to put incredible effort into their business and have been able to build their clientele little by little and create more earnings to support their small children. Their goals are big and they dream of opening other restaurants. They have committed to continue working diligently to achieve this goal. However, right now a more urgent matter is that her husband is in poor health and needs an expensive medical procedure. Gladys will continue working and this is why they are asking for a loan of $350 to improve the facilities of their location. Don't miss this valuable opportunity to work with Gladys. Helping her will help her whole family!

loans.use: Starting up a small Chinese restaurant

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Mrs. Christiana E. is a dealer in pure water and table water. She started her business in 1996 and seeks a loan to enable her to buy more pure water and table water for sale. With the funds, she will also buy a deep-freeze for cooling the water. She is 47 years old, married with 7 children, and lives in Benin City with her family. She has been in LAPO for 6 years.

loans.use: To buy more pure water and buy a deep-freeze for cooling water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Aida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Aida S. has four children for whom she has worked hard, along with her husband, in order to provide them with adequate education, proper nutrition and other basic needs. Located at her home in León, Ms. S.’s grocery store has been in business since her young age. She started with it at the time of a severe economic crisis. At the time, she had no idea how to support her children and decided to invest in this business.

With the experience acquired with time, the business has become stronger, and she has been able to cover her household expenses. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been granted timely, when she was in need of money to buy merchandise and stock up her store. She has a record of two loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Aida S. es madre de 4 hijos a los cuales, junto con su esposo, lucha por brindarles educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio de la señora S. es una pulpería, que desde muy joven ha venido desarrollando en su casa de habitación en León. El negocio lo comienza cuando atraviezan una fuerte crisis económica y nos dice que fue muy duro, ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos, por lo que decide invertir en este negocio.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha podido suplir las necesidades del hogar. Ella trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados, pues le han sido brindados cuando más lo necesitaba para la compra de todos los productos para su pulpería. Su record es de dos créditos con CEPRODEL.

loans.use: Stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Bishop A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Constance N.. She operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase the stock of shop items. Constance is 38 years old and is married. Her husband that is a house broker. She has 3 children ranging from ages 11 to 16, and her children go to school. Each week, Constance makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

Constance is joined in her small group by Eseza N., Rebecca W., Teo N., and Fatuma N.. Eseza N. sells charcoal and wants to purchase more charcoal for sale. Rebecca W. operates a restaurant and wants a loan to modernize her restaurant. Teo N. sells used clothing and wants to increase her inventory. Fatuma N. has a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase a refridgerator.

loans.use: To add to her shop inventory

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 38 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 26 and 18. Mariam sells products such as cloth and shoes; she started her business in 2003. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

In the past, Mariam has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Milena Del Rosario

texts.es:
Milena is 47 years old, single and has no children, she lives with her family (mother and siblings). At the young age of 17, when she was studying 12th grade, she started to teach without any formal training and with her own efforts she has been able to improve, due to the fact that she achieved her title of elementary school teacher and is currently working towards her Licentiate in Education. Because she was raised in a rural community, in addition to teaching, she also does production activities with the help of her brothers. With 8 previous loans, she has bought 3 calves and 1 stud, which she brands with her mother's branding iron. This 9th loan will be used to plant pasture to feed her animals and to plant corn for self consumption. This loan is urgent because winter is coming up and she needs to have the land ready for sowing.

Teacher T. is a loyal client because she started getting loans when the institution opened its doors to the waged-earning sector in 2001, when no banks or micro financing institutions would risk to work with vulnerable sectors. She feels fulfilled with the attention given to her, that's why she is still with us, she has an excellent sense of morality to pay back and most of the time she repays her loans one or two months in advance.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Milena de 47 años, soltera, no tiene hijos, habita junto a su familia (mamá y hermanos), desde muy jovencita a la edad de 17 años inicio el apostolado del magisterio de manera empirica, cuando estudiaba el 3er año de bachillerato, con su propio esfuerzo ha logrado superarse, ya que obtuvo su titulo de maestra de educacion primaria, tecnico medio en contabilidad y actualmente esta estudiando la Licenciatura en Pedagogia. Como ha sido criada en el campo, ademas de la docencia realiza labores productivas con el apoyo de sus hermanos. Con los 8 creditos anteriores ha comprado 3 vaquillas y un semental, los que herra con el fierro de su mama, este noveno credito lo utilizara para la siembra de 3 Mzs de zacate mejorado para la alimentacion de sus animales y 3 Mzs de maiz para el autoconsumo, la urgencia de este credito es porque ya se aproxima el invierno y quiere tener el terreno preparado para la siembra.

La profesora T. ha sido una cliente fiel, pues inicio con sus creditos cuando la institucion abre las puertas al sector asalariado en el año 2001, cuando ningun bancio ni microfiananciera se arriesgab a a trabajar con los sectores vulnerables. Ella se siente satisfecha de la atencion que ha sido objeto y es por eso que continua con nosotros, tiene una excelnte moral de pago, casi siempre paga con uno o dos meses de anticipacion sus creditos.

loans.use: Planting animal feed and corn

loans.name: Janelips Caistence

texts.es:
Janelips Velasques is from the Villanueva municipal in the Nicaraguan city, Chinandega. She has been working for the last 10 years in her general store, which has seen many changes over the years. Her greatest need is now the reconstruction of her home, which has deteriorated into poor conditions.

It is necessary to emphasize that Janelips is the mother of three small children, two of which are school-aged, and for them there is a need for improving living conditions. For this reason, Janelips is looking to Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will be used to acquire more construction materials for reconstructing her household, which is in need of immediate restoration.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Janelips Velasquez es originaria del municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica desde hace 10 años a su negocio de pulpería el cual ha venido desarrollando a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo. La necesidad que hoy en día ella atraviesa es la urgencia de la compra de los materiales para la reconstrucción de su vivienda presto que se encuentra en malas condiciones.

Es necesario destacar que ella es madre de tres pequeños hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que es su deber brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida y para esto es que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual poder adquirir los materiales de construcción para continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación el cual necesita una pronta remodelación.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Madémou

texts.fr:
Madémou C. is married and has been a member of the Bignona Bassène village bank for the last three and half years. She wants to strengthen her business selling dyed fabric, juice and ice cream made from “pain de singe” (baobab fruit), sugar, and bissap (a local drink made from hibiscus flowers). She uses her income to take part in family expenses, to pay for health care, and toward her children’s school costs. Madémou is seeking a loan that will be repaid with a single payment at the end of six months. 
Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer
Madémou C., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Bignona Bassène depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de tissus teintés et de jus et crèmes glaces fait à base de pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre et du bissap. Avec ses revenus elle participe à la dépense familiale, aux soins médicaux et à la scolarité des enfants. Madémou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Selling various products

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge B. Chamorro is 59 years old. He is married to Rufina Caballero de B. and is 57 years old. They have three grown children who are married.

Jorge and his wife own their home, where they have a small tire shop that he was able to set up with his savings.

Currently Jorge provides his services for light vehicles: cars, motorcycles and bicycles. Rufina, his wife, sells "minutas" (local herbs) to help out with the household expenses.

The loan will be used to purchase motorcycle and bicycle accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal Kiva volunteer

El señor Jorge B. Chamorro tiene 59 años de edad y su esposa la señora Rufina Caballero de B. de 57 años de edad tienen 3 hijos todos ya mayores de edad y casados.

Don Jorge y su esposa viven en su casa propia en donde tiene una pequeña gomería, la que monto gracias a un dinero que pudo ahorrar.

Actualmente don Jorge realiza trabajos de gomería para vehículos livianos: autos, motos y bicicletas, doña Rufina su esposa tiene venta de minutas y así ayuda también para el ingreso familiar.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de cámaras para motos y bicicletas.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle and bicycle accessories

loans.name: Fedelia

texts.en: Fedelia U. is 35 years old, and she is married with 7 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, coolers, and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more clothes for sale. She expresses her gratitude to all.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia A. is 40 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 3 and 18. She has been selling clothes and porridge since 2000. Every day, she works from 7:30am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Shadia is applying for a loan to improve her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Borka

texts.en:
Borka was born in 1959 and she lives in Doboj, a town in Bosnia. She is married and her husband works in a textile factory. While Borka does not have children, she runs a small daycare center from their home. She receives 350KM/month for this work (the equivalent of roughly USD$230.) Her income, when combined with that of her husband, is barely enough to meet their most basic needs. To generate additional income, Borka hopes to start cleaning people's houses on the weekends.

Borka requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women International, which she will use to purchase a high-quality vacuum cleaner. With this vacuum cleaner, she will start her second business: cleaning the houses of the wealthy in Doboj.

loans.use: To purchase a vacuum cleaner, which is needed before Borka can start working as a maid on the weekends.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun T., age 28, and her husband Sao Doch, age 31, are villagers in Pearaing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and work as farmers. However, they have such a small patch of land to cultivate that it is difficult to realize any return upon their investment of time and hard work. Thus, Mrs. Noeun T. are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 Riel in order to purchase another area of farmland on which to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To purchase another parcel of land for rice cultivation

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 59 años, vive con sus hijas que son casadas. Tiene 20 años D. experiencia en el comercio independiente, y con los ingresos que ella proveía pudo sostener a su familia, en la actualidad se sostiene así misma, saliendo cada fin D. semana con su pequeño puesto en una esquina D. las calles más comerciales D. su localidad para ofrecer los ricos lechones, que son el disfrute D. las personas que acuden a consumir este platillo a base D. cerdo, ella está muy animada D. seguir adelante por lo que   también trabaja en las festividades locales para aprovechar la frecuencia D. personas. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, es por ello que sigue trabajando con su banco comunal, y  su mejor garantirá es la responsabilidad demostrada desD. hace más D. 4 años. Con el dinero solicitado podrá abastecerse D. los insumos básicos para la elaboración D. su platillo, comprará un cerdo entero, además, implementará su negocio con café y vino.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 59 years old, she lives with her married daughters. She has 20 years of experience in independent business, and with the income she’s provided she has supported the family, and currently she supports herself, going out each weekend with her small business on a busy commercial street corner in her neighborhood to sell delicious sucklings (baby pigs), that are the delight of people who come to eat this pork-based dish, she is very excited about moving forward, so she also works the local festivals taking advantage of the large numbers of people. This is her 4th loan with MFP, it is for this reason she keeps working with this local bank, the responsibility she’s demonstrated in over more than four years of lending is her best guarantee. With the money she’s requesting, she will be able to stock up on costly basics making her pork dish better, she will buy an entire pig, and in addition, she will augment the business with coffee and wine.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to improve her pork dish

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is fifty years old. She is widow and the mother of seven children. Georgina is resourceful and enterprising. She has supported three children to graduation from high school through her business. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like “fufu” and “banku” along with drinks. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain with mortar and pestle, which is taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She says her working capital is inadequate and barely support her business.

With the loan, she wants to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality. Precisely, she would buy more ingredients like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. As a single parent, Georgina believes your support to her business progress would eventually increase her ability to educate the rest of her children to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mr. Mai M. is a 56-year-old farmer in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He owns a 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. So Nhor, is a cow breeder. Even though they work hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living, Mr. Mai M. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets to start a pig-breeding business and to buy a cow for his wife’s business. They have one child, who is a construction worker. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and a cow.

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en: Wilson N. is a proud member of the Kiwamirembe Women’s group and has a retail shop that he has been running with the help of loans. His first loan was used to buy more products for his shop. As a result, he has been able to take care of his family’s needs and to pay the children’s school fees. He has also started up a fresh fruits and vegetables business for his wife, and his dream is to open up another shop for his wife to manage. He is very grateful for the loans because his well-being depends on them.

loans.use: Restock his shop.

loans.name: Ablodalo

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Zanguéra, Mme Ablodalo H. vit actuellement à Kladjémé avec sa famille. Mariée et mère de huit (08) enfants, elle est cultivatrice comme son mari. Sa culture principale est le mais. A cet effet, elle sollicite un financement pour augmenter sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais afin de rendre la terre plus fertile. La réalisation de ce projet va rendre ses rendements croissants et par ricochet ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Zanguéra, Ms. Ablodalo H. currently lives in Kladjémé with her family. She is married, the mother of eight children, and a farmer like her husband. She mainly grows corn. To that end, she’s requesting financing for extending her arable lands and for buying manure, so as to make the earth more fertile. The success of this project will lead to increasing yields and thus immediately rebounding revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing corn

loans.name: Abida Abdul Majeed Group

texts.en:
Abida baji is a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. Abida baji is married to A. M. who runs a mobile phone shop where he sells used mobile phones at cheap rates. Abida baji is the mother of eight kids: seven daughters and one son. All of her kids are enrolled in a local school located near to the house. Abida baji operates a sewing clothes business. She sews clothes to meet the financial expenses of her house so that her husband can relax and concentrate on work. Abida baji successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for the fourth time to buy mobile phones for her husband’s shop.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps and pipes) to sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy used mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra B. is from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 and married with two children. Her husband is a laborer with no regular income. She accessed a loan from Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, after becoming a member in January 2009.  She asked for a loan credit of P7,000 in order to have additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store business. The couple’s aspirations are to send their children to school, to be able to provide for their daily needs and for their children to have a good life.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Maria Arcadia

texts.es: Maria Arcadia S. vive en Santa Tecla, dentro del departamento D. la Libertad en la zona occidental del país, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Carecer D. educación básica y formal, nunca ha sido un impedimento para Maria, quien ha recompensado su ausencia en la escuela, con un vivido espíritu D. lucha que distingue al emprendedurismo.  DesD. hace ya nueve años, Maria Arcadia maneja un cafetín donD. emplea a dos personas más. Maria solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio, y adquirir materia prima y productos alimenticios que le permitan obtener las herramientas necesarias para expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Arcadia S. lives in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad, in the western area of the country, with her husband and two children. Lacking a basic and formal education has never been an obstacle for Maria, who has compensated for her absence of schooling with a fighting spirit of an enterprising person. For nine years, Maria Arcadia has managed a small tavern, where she employs two people. Maria is requesting this loan to reinvest in her business and buy raw materials and food products, which will allow her to obtain the necessary tools to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Efuah

texts.en: Efuah N. is married and has 2 children. She has not received any formal education. Efuah sells smoked fish in a very small quantity in Abura, which she has done for 15 years. Her husband is a cleaner who provides a small income, which cannot support the needs of the family. Efuah uses all her income for feeding the entire family and paying for school fees for the children. Efuah will use the loan to purchase fish, process and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efuah plans to re-invest.

loans.use: To purchase fish, process and sell.

loans.name: Aminata C.

texts.en:
This is Aminata C. S.. She is a local entrepreneur in Magburaka town. She sells market food: bulgur wheat, rice, beans, salt, pepper and even soap and charcoals right at the center of town. This will the forth loan this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva. Aminata has benefited a lot from previous SMT/Kiva loans. Her business grew, enabling her start a new stall. Her level of income improves and her standard of living also improves. Aminata has made her last loan repayment as a member of a solidarity group, qualifying her for an individual loan. She is now asking for an individual loan of SLL2,000,000. With this loan, she will be able to travel to Freetown (404 miles round trip from Magburaka) to buy the goods she sells in wholesale.

Aminata is now forty; she was born in Magburaka town. She is married to a teacher and they have five children. Three of their children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools. She has been a businesswoman for over ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Yibem

texts.en:
Born on the 21st March 1957, Pa S. married and has six children, 2 of which are below the age of fifteen years. Pa S. and his family lives  in a two room’s apartment in the Baingo neighbor hood in Belo Sub division in the NWR of Cameroon.    
Due to circumstances beyond his control he hadn’t any privilege to have basic education nor learn a trade because his parents where poor, worst of it all was the dead of his parents when he was still very young which occurred due to lake of money to pay for medication. Also her cocoa plantation was destroyed by fire. Motivated by all these circumstances and the need to bring up a good family, he became a member of GHAPE in 2008. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid his first loan of 40000FCFA and the profit of this loan has helped him sustain his life and that of the family and also cater for the school needs of his children

Given a loan he plans to buy  plantain suckers , clearing of farm land and the purchase of two goats . He will use the profit of this loan to continue to educate his children and build a good house for the family. He thinks his business will succeed because his farm produce are highly needed in the urban centers of Bamenda, Bafussam and Yaonde and he has enough grazing land.
He plans to pay his loan in 12 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase of Suckers, clearing of farm digging of holes and the purchase of 2 goats.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married to Roxana Wanjiku and together they have three school-going children.  He is in the business of selling fresh milk to residents of Naivasha Town. His milk bar is well located, just next to the Naivasha District Hospital, so his milk supply is always in demand.

Joseph was introduced to KADET by a friend of his who is also a KADET client. This is his second loan with KADET. Because his clientele is ever-increasing, he is requesting the loan to buy another heifer so he can increase production of milk. 

His dream is to grow his business and get tenders to supply milk from area institutions and restaurants, and one day to have a processing plant for milk products.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase another cow to increase milk output.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing peanuts and corn

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena C., 26 years old mother of a seven-year-old kid owns and manages an eatery business in Tagbilaran Bohol. She said that her income is very sufficient to support her family needs. But she never stops dreaming of having a bigger restaurant in the future. In that way, she said, sending her child to good schools is easier.

She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchased ingredients needed for her eatery. 

Hopefully, she will be able to earn bigger income after receiving a loan in CEVI. The interest rate is only 2% and she said, she could definitely repay what she owes.

loans.use: to buy banana and vegetables for carenderia

loans.name: Criss

texts.es:
Criss es una joven soltera, es mujer dinámica y trabajadora, tiene 21 años de edad, estudiante de educación inicial,  se dedica a la elaboración de flores, bisutería, y vende prendas de vestir, pues ella le ayuda a su tía  en este negocio. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace cuatro años, ella empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles y lo invirtió en la compra de prendas de vestir. 
Con este préstamo de 1000 soles, comprará prendas vestir, materiales para elaborar flores y adornos del hogar, también invertirá en piedras para aumentar su bisutería. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda de prendas de vestir, calzados, carteras y adornos para el hogar.

loans.use: Comprará prendas vestir, materiales para  elaborar flores y adornos para el hogar. Comprará piedras de bisutería.

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es: “Suma Sartawi”, es el nombre que agrupa una asociación de doce personas, que se  reúnen en el centro focal Villa Exaltación  hace más de tres años. Entre las tantas actividades que tienen este grupo tenemos a Martha que se dedica a la costura al igual que Irlanda, Asencia M. tiene un  puesto de dulces  y galletas, Regina vende carne de Res, Irma prepara deliciosos jugos en base a quinua, Juan vende DVD de forma ambulante, mencionamos también  a Lidia que actualmente se dedica  a la venta de cuadros artesanales, estos los comercializa en el atrio de la Iglesia San Francisco, de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta que lamentablemente aun no cuenta con servicios básicos en su hogar, necesita ingresos mayores para poder solventar estos servicios para el bienestar de sus hijos. En este nuevo ciclo la asociación Suma Sartawi, afirman que necesitan reforzar capital a sus negocios, adquiriendo variedad de productos (cuadros, variedad de dulces, leche, carne, telas y otros)
texts.en:
The name “Suma Sartawi” unites an association of 12 persons who have met for 3 years in the community banking center Exaltation Villa. Among the great many activities of this group we have Martha, who dedicates herself to needlework, the same as Irlanda; Asencia has a stall selling sweets and cookies; Regina sells beef; Irma prepares delicious juices based on quinoa, and Juan sells DVDs on the streets. We should mention Lidia who sells artisan pictures in the atrium of the San Francisco Church in the city of La Paz. Lamentably, she still lacks basic services in her home and needs greater income in order to be able to solve this problem for the wellbeing of her children.

In this new loan cycle the Suma Sartawi association affirms that the loan is needed to resupply their businesses with capital, acquiring a variety of products (pictures, sweets, milk, meat, cloth, and other items).

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Oumou Banouna

texts.fr: Oumou est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Son activité est le commerce de détail.  Elle vends divers poduits(riz,sucre,lait,huile et autres)dans sa boutique. Elle a eu 14 expériences avec le crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle contribue beaucoup au bien être de sa faimlle.
texts.en:
Oumou is a 37-year-old woman, married with her three children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Loan Group of Tenghory Diamalaye for 7 years. She is in the retail business and sells various products in her shop, including rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She has had 14 previous loan experiences and has never had a problem with repayment. She contributes significantly to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her small business

loans.name: San Juan De Matucana Group

texts.es:
SAN JUAN D. MATUCANA
Esta alcancía comunal participa diez personas quines trabajan con EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD más dos años y medio, los créditos que reciben lo invierten en sus negocios, sus ingresos contribuyen en los gastos D. sus hogares, así mismo mejoran su calidad D. vida. Así tenemos el caso D.:
Sarela M. E. nos cuenta que en su casa criaban animales (patos, pavos, conejos) éstos eran vendidos y también servía D. alimentos para ellos, tuvo además una llama (auquénido) que era la mascota D. la familia.
Sarela ya casada con un hijo llevó a su casa a un cuy que iba a ser sacrificado por su mamá sin saber que estaba preñada y que más adelante tendría ingresos, así compró un macho y así fueron aumentando cada vez más lo cual necesitaba D. un mayor capital para comprar el alimento (cullina, engorD. y pasto) es así que deciD. adquirir créditos para seguir trabajando, pero con el tiempo dejó D. hacerlo porque llegó a tener ciento cincuenta D. estos animalitos y ya no era lo suficiente para mantenerlos, lo cual tuvo que venderlos, juntó un capital que le serviría para la inicial D. una mototaxi que hoy en día la siguen pagando con los ingresos D. la mototaxi. Resultó más a cuenta este nuego negocio que ella y su esposo piensan comprar otra más porque actualmente su esposo no cuenta con un trabajo estable. D. esta manera Sarela seguirá siendo un apoyo en los gastos D. su familia. Necesita el préstamo porque quiere invertir en ropa (pantalones, casacas, edredones reversibles) lo cual lo venderá a sus amistades, conocidos porque es tiempo D. invierno.
texts.en:
The San Juan D. Matucana Communal Bank consists of ten people who have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than 2½ years. The loans they have received were invested into their businesses. As a result, the income they generate help pay for their household expenses and improve their quality of life.

Take the example of Sarela M. E.. She tells us that she raises animals (ducks, turkeys, and rabbits) out of her home. Most of the animals are sold, but some are set asiD. to feed her family. She also has a llama that serves as the family pet. Sarela is married and has one child.

It all started one day when she brought home a guinea pig for her mother to prepare as a meal, but she did not know at the time she purchased it that it was pregnant. She eventually found out about it in time and was able to earn an income from the offspring. Sarela acquired a male guinea pig so that she could continue the momentum of her new business. She needed additional capital to buy food (grasses and feed for fattening) for the animals, so she applied for a loan so that she could keep her business running. At one point, she had as many as 150 guinea pigs, which was too much to handle. Sarela was able to sell all of the animals and use the capital to purchase a motorcycle taxi, from which she continues to receive rental income to this day.

Sarela and her husband are considering starting another business since he does not have a stable job at the moment. She continues to be the primary support for covering her family’s expenses. Sarela is requesting a loan to purchase trousers, jackets, and comforters. She plans to sell these items to friends and acquaintances for the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, este cliente se dedica arduamente a laborar con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar compuesto por su esposa y por sus tres pequeños hijos en edad escolar a los que le debe proporcionar las condiciones necesarias para vivir.

El se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su familia y para ello ha solicitado un crédito porque requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque se ha encontrado muy maltratada y necesita brindarles a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir. Es por esta razón que espera que el crédito le sea otorgado para a lo inmediato comprar los materiales de construcción y así dar lugar al trabajo en el cambio de techo y reparación del piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua this client works arduously to support his household, which is comprised of his wife and their three school aged children. He needs to provide them with the necessary living conditions. He has worried about the well being of his family. That is why he is asking for a loan. He needs to improve their home’s condition. It is battered, and he needs to provide his children with a decent roof to live under. That is why he hopes the loan is granted so that he can immediately buy the construction material. That way the work to change the roof and the floor repair on his house can start.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
S. was born in 1986 and is a married mother blessed with a young child. She currently works sewing clothes in a factory and gets a stable salary of $90 a month. She was busy with her job when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

As another income source, S.’s husband has the skill of making wooden statues by hand and has been a local statue carver for years. S. saw that her husband’s carving business has provided her family with much income, so she hopes to upgrade this business to be more efficient by using a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To upgrade her husband's carving business

loans.name: Jocelie

texts.en: Jocelie B. is from the town of Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Jocelie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jocelie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other materials needed for the expansion of her garden. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Jocelie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other materials needed for the expansion of her garden

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy J. is from the village of Mobod. She is 36 years old. Cristy is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Cristy owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. In 2001, Cristy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Cristy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house & store. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina S. is 35 years old, single, and has no children. She is a very strict and hardworking lady. For the last two years, she has been running a general store where she sells products such as soft drinks, bread, sugar, rice and hair extensions. She sells her products to local people, schools and colleges. Her business is located at Khayega in Kakamega, in a busy market along a busy road. In addition to her general store, she also provides computer services.
Carolina works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure her business' success in a market where there are many other traders engaging in the same kind of business as hers. Her major challenge is lack of funds, and that is why she is requesting a loan to increase her stock in order to grow her business. Carolina is also using her loan to start up a car wash to generate extra income. Her hope is to improve her living standards and build a beautiful house for herself. She also dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soft drinks, rice and beauty products to sell

loans.name: San Andres Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento "SAN ANDRES " es uno del los grupos  màs antiguos D. la agencia , se encuentra en su octavo ciclo., el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

La Sra. Martha es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. hamburguezas  en la calle Pedro Ceballos en villa Pagador . Esta casada y tiene 1 hija que se encuentra en edad escolar y la Sra Martha corre con todos los gastos del hogar.

Como Tesorera esta la  Sra Silvia ella es viuda  su esposo murio en un accidente D. transito y tiene 6 hijos su negocio es  venta D. empanadas  en la Av. Petrolera ,es una persona muy responsable y puntual, su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales ya que ella trabaja duro para dar una  vida mejor a sus hijos.

La secretaria es la Sra Rielmy ella soltera no tiene hijos y  tambien tiene el negocio D. venta D. empanadas  ella es joven muy  activa y responsable.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Andres" is one of the agency's oldest groups, maD. up of responsible and hardworking people. This bank is currently in its eighth loan cycle and is represented by the following members: Martha is the leader and founder of the group. She has a hamburger business on Pedro Ceballos street in the town of Pagador. She is married and has one daughter, who is of school age. Martha takes care of all the domestic expenses. The secretary's name is Silvia. She is a widow whose husband was killed in a traffic accident. She has six children, and for a living she sells empanadas on Petrolera Avenue. Silvia is a very responsible and punctual person, and her desire is to see her children become professionals, since she works really hard to give them a better life. Rielmy is the bank's secretary. She is single with no children, and also has an empanada business. She is young, very active, and responsible. All of the members are appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to them through the grant of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla N. is from the village of Sta. Claro Road, Barangay 20, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Priscilla is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Priscilla owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Priscilla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Priscilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Priscilla is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Priscilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny G. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Beatingo, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store. Jennie’s husband, Francis, works as a caretaker of the fish ponds. They have two children, 6 and 9 years old, who are currently going to school while helping their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Jenny joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000. Jenny is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 5,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 9,000 for her 4th loan, which she intends to use for her general store. Jenny is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en: Servilla S. is from the village of Owaon. She is 55 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Servilla owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,700 PHP a month. In 2007, Servilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Servilla is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mr. Ben Chi Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of ten members, is located in Prey Run village in Takeo province. Mr. Ben C. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who all plan to use their loans for different purposes.

Mr. Ben C. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support his family. His wife is a wine and gasoline seller in the local village. He is the father of three children, two of whom are teachers, while the third attends the local public school. Mr. Ben C. is facing some obstacles because his rice field is infertile but he does not have enough money to improve it. Thus, Mr. Ben C. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer. He would use the rest of the loan to start a new business and buy three piglets for breeding . Mr. Ben C. is busy with his rice field so his wife came instead of him to take out the loan .

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  femmes du groupe JIGUISSEME sont toutes mariées,  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et  3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames  à Siekourani un village de la sous préfecture de LOULOUNI   région de Sikasso 3 e région du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’agrandir leurs activités. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers, condiments, charbon de bois et  de céréales telle le riz   avec Machitan B..
Machitan B. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  4sacs de 50 kg de riz . Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Loulouni et dans les foires des villages voisins. 
Le riz est revendu en détail au marché de Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 6 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités commerciales.
texts.en:
The eight women in the Jiguisseme group are all of an average age of 40, and are married with three children each. They mostly live in polygamous families in Siekourani, a village in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, in Sikasso, the third largest administrative region of Mali. They are on their first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of boosting their business activities. The women sell various items, such as condiments, firewood and cereals, such as rice, with Machitan B.. Machitan B. aims to use this loan to buy four 50kg bags of rice. She sources this from the Loulouni market and in the neighbouring village markets. The rice is sold for cash at the Loulouni market to a customer base made up of men and women. She envisages enerating an average monthly profit of 6,000 FCFA - a small proportion of this will be used to save for social ends and the rest re-invested in business activities.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchasing rice

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en: Ma. Bella L. is from the town of Talibon. She is 43 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Bella owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ma. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years now. In 2005, Ma. Bella joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy materials for a water tank. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hernaldo Jose

texts.es: Hernaldo José 25 años, por lo que su actividad es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado, ya que le gusta levantarse temprano para conseguir la leche, y realizar la elaboración de cuajada. Por lo que el negocio es de herencia familiar,  con mucho sacrificio ha logrado sacarlo adelante. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Sueña con engrandecer cada día su actividad.
texts.en:
Hernaldo José is twenty-five years old and sells dairy products for a living. He has been doing this work for sixteen years because he loves it. He loves getting up early in the morning to get the milk and start making the curd. He inherited his business from his family and has had to work hard to build it up. The loan he is taking out is buy raw materials for his business. He dreams of growing his business everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maira Elieth

texts.es:
la sra. Maira Elieth L. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan y nacatamales actividad que viene realizando por mas de 5 años.
