El señor Santos Irineo es casado, tiene 26 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales aun no están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa nueva, inició su negocio vendiendo en las plazas, tiene 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de ropa de diferentes tamaños, suéteres, bufandas, pants, sudaderos, chumpas, y entre otros tipos de ropa. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades al comercio y a la crianza de animales. En el futuro espera ver su negocio con una cadena de tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos Irineo is 26 years old, married, and has a sixth grade education. He has three children who are not yet in school. Santos sells new clothing and started out offering his goods in the town squares. He has 15 years of experience and receives the support of his wife, who handles the household chores.

Santos decided to organize a group so that he could request a loan for purchasing clothes in different sizes such as sweaters, scarves, trousers, sweatshirts, jackets, and other types of garments. The other members of this group engage in different business activities such as trade and livestock breeding. In the future, Santos hopes to see his business turn into a chain of clothing stores.

loans.use: to purchase different types of clothing.

loans.name: Naskul's Group

texts.en:
Naskul is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up four daughters and a son. The first daughter studies at university and other children are in school. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family breeds cattle and then resells them at a higher price. Naskul applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more cattle. In the future, Naskul wants to give her children a good education and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Habit

texts.es:
Habit de 35 años vive con su cónyuge en el suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, oficio en el cual sus principales clientes son mujeres amas de casa, a quienes descarga del desafiante oficio de lavar manualmente bajo el candente sol del Caribe Colombiano. Hace 10 años decidió iniciar su ejercicio emprendedor, cuando con el producto de su trabajo como celador decidió comprar 8 lavadoras de contado y desde entonces se afana diariamente por lograr sostenerse en el mercado, con calidad y oportunidad en su oferta. Su meta más adelante es adquirir una motocicleta para lograr un transporte más efectivo, desde el sitio donde está ubicado su negocio hasta donde lo requiera  cada cliente. 
En la actualidad Habit está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque quiere continuar creciendo, así es que con con su credikiva, planea aumentar su cobertura comprando 3 lavadoras más, que le ayudarían a generar mayores ingresos, pues pierde clientes porque las máquinas con las que cuenta, se mantienen de servicio en casa de sus clientes y su creciente clientela requiere mayor atención y ser más oportuno,  para seguir perfeccionando su trabajo. Mientras se esfuerza por mejorar, maneja en su negocio una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 40%  y una autonomía de 91%, y con ello cada día   pretende aumentar su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en: Habit is 35 years old and lives with his wife in southwestern Barranquilla. He makes a living renting washing machines. His main customers are housewives who no longer want to manually wash items under the hot sun in Caribbean Colombia. He decided to start this business 10 years ago when as a product of his job as a guard he decided to buy eight washing machines with cash, and since then he strives daily to satisfy his market. His goal for the future is to acquire a motorcycle so he has better transportation from where his business is located to where each customer needs him to be. Habit is applying for his first loan with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because he wants his business to continue to grow. With the loan, he plans to add three more washers to his inventory, which will help him generate more revenue, since he has lost customers because the machines he has are loaned out to other clients and his growing customer base requires more attention so he can keep perfecting his craft. While he works hard to improve, his business handles a return on sales of no less than 40 percent and an autonomous consumption rate of 91 percent. He works every day to improve his welfare and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase three more washing machines.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 27 and has been in the farming business for 2 years in his hometown of Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. His farm produces maize, milk and beans. He is married with one child, age 2 years old.

Eric has requested Juhudi Kilimo to advance him a loan of 26,167 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will help him improve his family living standards. His focus for the dairy business is to have a farm of 3 dairy cows in 5 years.

Eric says the greatest challenge in farming are pests affecting both animals and crops.

loans.use: to pay for purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been in farming for 18 years in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya. She is married with four children who are all schooling. Her farm produces eggs and cereals for the local market and she has employed two farmhands.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds and expand her poultry unit for more birds. She says the expansion will improve her income and enable her to pay for the education of her children.

Elizabeth is, however, concerned with fluctuation in market prices and common diseases. She is happy with Juhudi's training for farmers.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds and expand her poultry unit

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.en:
Maria Sofia is 21 years of age and she is a single woman with no children. Maria Sofia owns & operates a business venture selling food products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Maria Sofia needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new items to expand products in her shop.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Maria Sofia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Maria Sofia's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product range in her shop.

loans.name: Rovilyn

texts.en:
Rovilyn is married with 1 child. Rovilyn is 27 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Rovilyn sells jewelry to earn a living and has had this retail business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 3000PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 8000PHP to purchase jewelry to sell.

Rovilyn has been a member of PMPC for than 1 year. In the future, Rovilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa trabaja como docente de la Escuela Mauricio Cajina desde hace 25 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, solicita su 8vo credito, para arreglar la cocina de su vivienda, ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo  quien se desempeña como electricista el cual  asume con  todos los gastos del hogar, esta humilde familia son bien unidos y profesan la religion evangelica, su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos estudien  para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en: Candida Rosa has worked as a teacher at the Escuela Mauricio Cajina for 25 years, fulfilling her duties with honesty and a sense of responsibilty. She is asking for this her 8th loan to repair her kitchen. She has the help of her husband who is an electrician and assumes all the household expenses. This humble family are close-knit and profess to be Evangelists. The biggest dream of their lives is that their children study to be good people.

loans.use: to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Ondua

texts.en:
Ondua is a 30 year old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.
Ondua has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to able to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the profits from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr:
Mme Aïsseta est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Les 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes, depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter une balle de pagnes et 04 rouleaux de tissus.

Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour agrandir son hangar. Elle ambitionne ouvrir d’autres points de vente de pagnes et aider son mari à construire une maison d’habitation, mettre l’eau et le courant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïsseta is married and the mother of three children, who all attend school. She has six persons to support.

For eight years, she's been selling pagnes (colorful African cloth). She gets her supplies from the provinces.

Her customers are both women and men. She wants to buy one bale of pagnes and four rolls of fabric.

Mrs. Aïsseta uses her profits to enlarge her warehouse. She ambitions to open additional pagnes points of sale, and to help her husband build a house with electricity and running water.

loans.use: to buy one bale of pagnes and four rolls of fabric

loans.name: Chebet

texts.en:
Chebet is age 28, single with one child aged 5. She has been in the farming business for 8 years and currently produces tea and milk for the local market.

Chebet has made a loan request to Juhudi Kilimo amounting to  30,000 KES to enable her  buy a chaff cutter for her dairy farm. (A chaff cutter is a mechanical device for cutting straw or hay into small pieces — before being mixed together with other forage and fed to horses and cattle. This aids the animal's digestion and prevents animals from rejecting any part of their food.)

Chebet says this will ease the feeding of  her dairy cows and reduce waste  incurred when the dairy animals are fed without cutting the feeds to size. She hopes she will be able to double her milk output and give better care to her child.

Chebet laments the dry conditions which affect the productivity of both the dairy and tea businesses.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia, age 38, owns and operates a retail shop in Kyenjojo district. She has run this business for eight years. She started as a farmer, saved her money, and started the shop with her savings. 

She dreams of growing her business to a wholesale business and seeing her children educated. She is the mother of three children, aged between 10 and 20. 

Sylivia is requesting a loan in order to buy sugar to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar to offer for sale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a single parent and has five dependents. Nana produces gari (a food made from cassava) for sale. She also sells maize at Dompoase. Nana has been doing this for the past 10 years now. She uses her income to provide for her children. Nana will use her loan to purchase bulk maize and cassava for the gari preparation. She intends to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to buy bulk maize and cassava for gari preparation

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia, de 22 años, es una mujer joven, amable y muy emprendedora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 5 y 1 año, ellos son su motivo de trabajo, esfuerzo y sacrificio, pues desea brindarles siempre lo mejor y mejorar su calidad de vida. JUntos habitan en casa de sus padres junto a ellos. El trabajo de Lilia consiste en la compra y venta de ganado, sale los fines de semana a la ganadería del distrito, ahí busca a los mejores ganados y los que están a mejor precio. Una vez comprados son sacrificados en el camal, lugar donde trabaja y expende la carne a sus clientes. Se indicio en este negocio con otro tipo de animales, con el tiempo fue creciendo y ahora se dedica exclusivamente a lo venta de carne de res. Lleva trabajando así ya por tres años y lo hace a lado de su conviviente quien siempre la apoya en el trabajo encargandose de lo más pesado, mientras ella se encarga de administrar, así tiene tiempo de cuidar a sus hijos. Gana un promedio de 30% de su inversión y desde que empezó a trabajar con este negocio le esta yendo mejor ya que antes tenia muchos problemas económicos ya que no había mayores ingresos. Ella como toda mujer emprendedora desea hacer crecer su negocio. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a pagar de manera puntual y responsable todas sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará más cabezas de ganado para seguir expendiendo carne de res.
texts.en:
Lilia, 22, is a friendly, and very enterprising young woman. She lives with her partner, and they have two children, ages five and one. They are the reason for her work, effort, and sacrifice, as she wants to always provide them with the best, and improve their quality of life. They live in her parents' house. 

Lilia buys and sells cattle. On the weekends she goes out to the local cattle farms, and looks for the best cattle, and those that are the best price. Once she buys them, they are slaughtered in the abattoir where she works, and then the meat is sent to her customers. 

She started off in this business with other types of animals. With time, her business gradually grew, and now she sells beef exclusively. She has been working at this for three years now, and does it alongside her partner.  He always supports her, by looking after the heaviest work, while she looks after the running of the business, so she has time to take care of their children. 

She earns an average of 30% on her investment, and since she began to work in this business, it's been going better for her.  Previously, she had many financial problems, as there wasn't a lot of income. 

As all enterprising women do, she wishes to see her business grow. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, so she is hoping for your contribution so that she can continue working toward her goals. Moreover, she is once again committed to paying her instalments responsibly, and on time. 

With the amount of 2,000 soles that she is applying for, she will buy more head of cattle, so that she can continue selling beef.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Tashinga Group

texts.en:
Farai is 42 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 5.  The eldest attends school. She has one other dependent, her sister's child. She receives a source of income from renting her other house.

Farai operates a shop at the new market centre in town. She has been in business for two years and has one employee. She buys her products from South Africa.  She faces a challenge in the high import duty on the products she sells, which raises her product costs.  She would like to own a boutique in town and to finish building her house. In generating profits, she can pay for her children's school fees and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes, buckets, blankets, shoes

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba  is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Aba sells Fante kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Ankwanda near Elmina, which she has done for 3 years. Aba uses her income to assist her husband to take care of the home. Aba will use the loan to purchase more maize in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk to produce kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) to sell

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: Léa est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Léa a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Léa est mariée a un certain Roger. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Léa vend depuis une dizaine d'année, des produits de mercerie à son domicile. Léa achète ses produits au Bénin et au Nigeria. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Léa contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Léa sollicite pour une cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Léa ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Léa is 42 years old and lives in Benin. Léa stopped going to school in elementary school. Léa is married to a man named Roger. The couple has three children, all of whom attend school and are under their care. The children live with their parents. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. To contribute to the diverse needs of the family, Léa has been selling dry goods from her home for about ten years. Léa buys these products in Benin and in Nigeria. Thanks to the revenue this business brings, Léa contributes to the different family expenses. In order to better meet the needs of her growing clientele, Léa is seeking her fifth loan from ALIDé. Her previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy dry goods

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 41 years old and married to Everlyne. They have five children. He has been running a grocery stall for the last five years, earning a monthly income of Kes 3,000.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. for Kes 30,000. He plans to use the funds to buy onions, tomatoes and fruit. With the anticipated profits of a larger stock, he will educate his children and save money.

His hopes and dreams are to own a big grocery store.

loans.use: To buy stocks of onions, tomatoes and fruit.

loans.name: Daba's Group

texts.fr:
Le bv de Diomkhel a été crée le 04 Juin 2011. Le groupe est composé de membres ayant des cohésions sociales. 

Debout à droite de la photo, la responsable est âgée de 28 ans. 

Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et 01 garçon. 

Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter des cochons de lait, les engraisser pendant un certain temps avant de les revendre. 

Avec les bénéfices générés par son activité, elle va construire sa maison, renforcer ses épargnes pour préparer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Diomkhel B.V. was founded June 4, 2011. The group is made up of members with social ties.

Standing up at the right of the photo, the leader is 28 years old.

She is married and mother of three children, two girls and a boy.

With the loan, she will buy suckling pigs and fatten them for a period of time before reselling them.

With the profits generated through this business, she is going to build her house and reinforce her savings to prepare for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs and raise them to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
My name is Yolanda, I am 43 years old, 4 years ago my husband left me. I have a daughter, that just had a little baby, she is a single mother. 

I have a grocery store, which I have had for the last 16 years old. My daughter works with me, and we have a lot of regular clients because we provide them very good service. My daughter had a baby two weeks ago, so she is not able to work at the moment. I work and cover all her expenses, including food, diapers and medicines for the baby. 

I am a fighter and always look out for my daughter. 

I will use the loan to buy groceries to get more variety and more products in my store, because a person that used to work for me stole some merchandise that I had bought with an other loan, despite these problem, I have continued to sell and pay the loan. 

I open monday through saturday from 7:30am a 12:30 am and sundays from 9:00 am to 12:30am. All my life is dedicated to working and helping my family, I cook and eat in the store.

My biggest accomplishment is taking care of my daughter and buying a car, that I lease and receive additional income.

I am responsible and even after going through dificult times, I keep fighting an dpaying my loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries for my store and repay a very expensive loan.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer trabajadora de 41 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Lari, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado ovino orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder pagar el alquiler de un terreno agrícola, en el cual planea sembrar cultivos orgánicos, con la venta de los cuales espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su pareja, y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para alquilar un terreno agrícola para sembrar cultivos orgánicos que pueda vender a un mayor precio para mejorar sus ingresos económicos

loans.name: Difas

texts.en:
Difas is married having 4 children and caring for 3 other. He is operating a retail shop and started it August this year.

He is facing a challenge of capital he start with $150 and currently having $200 as capital. His business is strategic and there are many customers around where he sells.

He is requesting for a loan of $1000 to help him improve on his stock by stocking variety of goods and this will help him get more profits hence improve on the standard of his business.

Any help given will be of great help to him and his family. He is capable of paying back promptly.

loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie D. is married with one child and takes care of another. She was born in 1972 in Asanhoun (in Avé prefecture). Very early on, she started selling charcoal because her husband, a teacher, earns a salary too meager to support the family. Everything rests on her shoulders. Despite her very limited education, she has a talent for managing her business. And so, to boost her business in order to take better care of her family, she is requesting a loan of $800. She can then stock enough charcoal to prevent supply shortages. This will result in worthwhile profits and thus a better future for her family.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Née en 1972 à Asanhoun, dans la préfecture de l’Avé, Madame D. Marie est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant et a à sa charge une autre personne. Très tôt elle s’est lancée dans la vente du charbon de bois à cause du maigre salaire de son mari enseignant qui n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Tout se repose sur la femme. Malgré son niveau d’étude très bas, elle est douée dans la gestion de ses activités. Ainsi pour renforcer ses activités afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui lui servira de faire un stock consistant afin d’éviter la rupture de stock ce qui rentabilisera son profit en vue d’un meilleur devenir de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase a larger inventory of charcoal for resale during times of scarcity

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en:
Oralia is a single mother of a 17 year old son who is in high school. With the need to support her son, as she never received help from her partner, Oralia decided to start her own business selling second-hand clothing in a street market eight years ago. With this business she obtained the income she needed to support her son and at the same time care for him. Fortunately, her business has grown and today, as a result of her clients needs, she also sells new clothes.

In order to increase her sales, Oralia would also like to sell in a different market place. She is seeking a loan for $700 dollars, in order to buy merchandise to be able to set up shop in this new vending site. Oralia wants for her business to continue growing and you can contribute in making this a reality. Oralia sincerely appreciates your help and care.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es madre soltera D. un hijo D. 17 años que actualmente es estudia L. preparatoria. Ante L. necesidad D. sostener a su hijo, ya que nunca contó con L. ayuda D. su pareja, Oralia decidió iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo ropa usada en un mercado hace ocho años, con esto podía recibir los recursos que necesitaba para el sustento D. su hijo y al mismo tiempo darle L. atención que necesita, afortunadamente su negocio ha estado creciendo y ahora, a petición D. sus clientes, también venD. ropa nueva.

Para incrementar sus ventas Oralia quiere instalarse en otro mercado, pero para esto requiere D. L. compra D. mercancía y solicita un préstamo por $ 700 dólares que utilizará con este fin. ElL. quiere que su negocio continué creciendo y tú puedes contribuir a que sea una realidad, elL. agradece sinceramente tu ayuda y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Surtir mercancía

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Since 1997 Mr Julian has owned a carwash in a well-known service station in the city. He starts work every day at 7am, assisting 2 others who work at his carwash. Throughout the day Mr Julian's business recieves many vehicles seeking his excellent work. Over time, he has aquired many clients, largely consisting of companies who send their full supply of vehicles to Mr Julian's carwash.

Several months ago Mr Julian's daughter was taken in for an emergency surgery, forcing Mr Julian to use some savings that were set aside for the purchase of an industrial vacuum. He owns only one, and this particular one cannot keep up with all the work. For this reason Mr Julian asks for a loan of 100 dollars to purchase a new industrial vacuum which will help him to speed up his work and keep up with his clients' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde 1997 Don Julián es dueño de un lavadero para autos que alquila en una conocida estación de servicios de la ciudad. Todos los días empieza su labor a las 7 de la mañana ayudado de 2 personales que trabajan también en su lavadero; en el transcurso del día reciben muchos vehículos que solicitan de su excelente labor. Con el tiempo han adquirido muchos clientes, en su mayoría empresas que envían su flota de vehículos para que Don Julián los lave.

Hace unos meses su hija menor tuvo que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente de urgencia, lo que lo obligo a utilizar unos ahorros que estaban destinados para la compra de una aspiradora industrial, pues él posee solo una y la que tiene no da abasto para todo el trabajo. Es por eso que Don Julián hoy solicita un crédito de $ 100 con lo que comprara una nueva aspiradora industrial que lo ayudara a agilizar su trabajo y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial vacuum

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan H. is a 40-year-old mother of eight children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to cook meals for her family, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Two of her children work at construction and the rest attend school.

Mrs. Phan H. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he won’t spend so much on public transportation when he goes to work every day. (This is a picture of her husband because Mrs. Phan H. was unavailable when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes works tirelessly to give her two school age daughters a better life. She has always worked toward building a sustainable future. From a young age she has been involved in sales, and for the last 20 years she has sold fodder (animal feed) and alfalfa for farm animals such as Guinea pigs and rabbits, among others. She does this job together with her husband, working as a team. In the beginning, she worked as a reseller, purchasing lots of alfalfa and reselling them in the local market. Thanks to her enthusiasm and the advice of some friends, she was able to obtain an alfalfa field so that she could grow her own product. Her business has now grown in spite of the fact that in some respects the business does not offer the same profitability that it once did. Even so, Lourdes continues to work, as she has other goals that she wishes to attain for the good of her family. She would like to produce more alfalfa in order to increase sales. In order to begin her project she is asking for a $200 loan. Lets help her to continue her hard work without obstacles so that she may continue offering her best to her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes trabaja incesantemente para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus dos pequeños hijos que están aún en edad escolar.Siempre ha trabajado para forjarse un futuro sostenible y es por esa razón que desde muy joven se dedica al comercio y hace veinte años específicamente a la venta de forraje o alfalfa para los animales de granja como cuyes y conejos entre otros.Esta actividad la realiza en compañía de su esposo con una mentalidad de trabajo de equipo, en un principio lo hacía como intermediaria, porque compraba por lotes la alfalfa para luego venderlas en el mercado local.Gracias al ánimo y consejo de una de sus amigas decidió adquirir un terreno de sembrío de alfalfa para comercializar lo que ella produce, en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido a pesar de que existen oportunidades en que el comercio ya no tiene el mismo auge de antes, aún así Lourdes seguirá trabajando porque quiere lograr otras cosas más por el bien de su familia.Quiere producir más alfalfa para incrementar sus ventas y con el objetivo de poner en marcha su proyecto solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares.Ayudémosla para que pueda seguir realizando su labor sin dificultades y siga brindándole lo mejor a su querida familia.

loans.use:
Purchase of seed to increase production and sales

Compra de semillas para incrementar su producción y venta.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia and her husband work cultivating and selling products such as coffee and citrus fruits, items very much in demand in their city. With this work they have been able to cover the basic household needs. Amelia begins working very early in the morning, fertilizing the crops and then returning to run her small shop where she sells every day necessities and groceries. The shop was set up with a lot of hard work to help sustain them during the harvest of their products. Her goal is to grow the business and begin distributing products in the city of Pichanaki, and in the different markets around the country, generating more income to prepare for their children's education. She is requesting a loan to help them meet their goals. Let's contribute and help this dedicated mother provide a better future for her children.

Amelia, es una madre amorosa de un pequeño niño; desde que formó su familia se dedica en compañía de su esposo a la producción y comercialización de café y productos cítricos, productos muy cotizados de su ciudad, con el que ha podido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Amelia inicia su jornada de trabajo muy temprano en la mañana, hora en que se dedica a cuidar sus cultivos con abonos y al término de esta labor se dispone rápidamente a atender en su pequeña tiendita de abarrotes, negocio que instauró con afán para sostenerse mientras espera la cosecha de sus deliciosos productos.El deseo que tiene es acrecentar mucho más su negocio para distribuir sus productos también en la ciudad de Pichanaki y en los diferentes mercados de los departamentos de su país y así generar mayores ingresos económicos para cubrir los estudios que dentro de poco tiempo iniciarán sus queridos hijos, por esa razón solicita un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos. Contribuyamos con esta dedicada madre para que siga forjando en su hogar un futuro prominente para sus hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY OF SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS TO EXPAND THE BUSINESS, INCREASE INCOME, AND BETTER PREPARE FOR THE COSTS OF EDUCATING HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eldaniz is 31-year-old man who raises livestock in a small village of the Imishli region. He has three years of experience in breeding calves. Now he needs $1200 to expand his farm and purchase additional four claves for cost an estimated $300 each.  He thanks you very much for this opportunity.

loans.use: Going to purchase additional four claves

loans.name: Ni Ketut Narti

texts.id:
Ketut Narti is a hardworking housewife. She works to help her husband, Nengah Nandra who is a labor. Narti runs a small stand in front of her house with Rp 1.000.000,- for the initial investment. Narti sells various traditional cakes that cooked by her or bought from the market. The business has been running quite long, i.e. since she got married. Narti is not only selling in front of the house, but sometimes when there is a special occasion in village government office, like meeting or other event, she moves to sell near the event is held, for there are many people there, that Narti wish what she sells could be sold faster. She earns Rp.50.000,- as income, and use it to pay her two children tuition fee. Narti hopes that the loan she wishes to earn from Dinari could help her to increase the capital of her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Ketut Narti seorang ibu rumah tangga yang rajin bekerja, untuk membantu suaminya, Nengah Nandra, yang bekerja sebagai buruh. Narti membuka warung yang kecil dan sangat sederhana di depan rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Narti melengkapi warungnya dengan beraneka ragam jajanan tradisional baik yang dibuat sendiri maupun yang dibelinya dari pasar. Usaha ini sudah dijalankan sejak lama, sejak menikah dengan suaminya.Tetapi Narti tidakhanya berjualan di rumah saja, terkadang jika ada kegiatan di kantor desa seperti rapat dan juga kegiatan yang lainnya maka Narti akan berpindah tempat berjualan yaitu disekitar balai Desa karena banyak orang yang datang kesana, dengan harapan barang dagangannya cepat habis terjual. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perhari bisa mencapai Rp.50.000,-Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membiayai kedua anaknya yang masih sekolah. Narti berharap pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari diharapkan dapat menambah modal usahanya.

loans.use: To increase business capital to renovate the stand and add offer more products to be sold

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Martina M.. She is married with two children, aged 13 and 15.

In 2007, Martina established a bar. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, seven days a week, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $85 per month from this business. Martina now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of beer in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $30. In the future, Martina also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Her bar is a good place to chill with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where you kick back on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to anyone and everyone who happens to wander by.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer for her pub in bulk.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. is a 50-year-old married mother of two living children. She has spent twenty-three years running her small vegetable kiosk in the outskirts of Kisumu, Kenya. She has integrated her business to include cereals to enable her to maximize her profits. Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation and many years in business coupled with a well-established client base ensure that her business will continue to grow despite stiff competition. Grace has received three previous loans from KMET/KIVA which she has used to scale up her business in order to cope up with the demand. She has applied for a loan of US $700. She plans to purchase an additional stock of cereals and vegetables and save the balance to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es:
Mrs. Uriarte has been working with this institution for four years. Throughout this time she was able to receive seven loans, which have been used for her fruit and vegetable stand. She is married, husband does woodshop. They have two chidren who attend school.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Uriarte trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace cuatro años obteniendo en este periodo siete creditos los que han sido dirijidos a capital de trabajo ya que ella tiene un tramo de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Sutiava, es casada el marido se desempeña como albañil y trabaja por cuenta propia tiene dos hijos los que estudian.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hằng is 59 years old. She's requesting 2.478.000 VND to raise pigs. She also sells basic good at the market to increase her wages. This is her second loan with SEDA, the first one has been paid off. She likes SEDA program because she can pay back in installments.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Lợi is requesting 2.478.000 VND to buy wood. She makes furniture.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn Thị Hằng (MS: 070014), năm nay 59 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND về chăn nuôi lợn. Ngoài ra cô còn đi chợ để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Cô đã tham gia vay vốn được một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt. Cô rất thích với hình thức trả góp này vì thu nhập của cô thường xuyên. Chị Nguyễn Thị Lợi (MS: 070033), vay 2.478.000 VND về mua thêm gỗ đóng bàn ghế bán.

loans.use: raise pigs

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia G. is 48 years old and married to Miguel Angel Tullo; together they have a son named Fernando. Aurelia began her business selling homemade baked goods (cakes, alfajores, piononos) and ice cream, which she sold house to house, and later took to the canteen (take-away prepared food stand) at the Rca. De Nicaragua school. Thanks to her effort and creativity, she has saved money and been able to start a small store that is currently a lovely dispensary named San Fernando Dispensa.

Thanks to her sacrifices and good administration she is progressing forward. With her income, she pays for the studies of her only son at the University, because her greatest desire is that her son becomes a professional.

The credit will be used to buy sugar, noodles, and herbs.

loans.use: The credit will be used to buy sugar, noodles, and herbs.

loans.name: Khadija's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
25-year-old Khadija is married with two children, aged 6 and 2. She has a business where she sells clothes, juice and ice cream everyday from 8am to 9pm. She earns a monthly profit of $90 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tatu M..

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Sadulla

texts.en: Sadulla lives in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1959, is married, and has 4 children. He has run this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman N. is 34 year old and is married with two sons. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells women's clothes and shoes. Elman's family is actively involved in helping with the business. Elman is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to become a successful entrepreneur. Elman`s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that, someday, they'll become successful entrepreneurs themselves. We believe his perseverance and clear vision are key factors in the success of his small business.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and saint places. She owns a six room brick house and has been living in it for the last 18 years. Abida baji is involved in a dress making business. She buys clothes from the market and then she sews them and makes embroidery on them. When she completes dresses, she sells them in boutiques and charges good prices. She sells one dress for $18. Her monthly income is $600 to $700. She is applying for a loan to buy material (clothes, colored thread and sketches) to fulfill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: To buy material to complete orders

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Art K., 27, is married and lives with two young children and her husband in the Prey Veng province. Since 2005, she has been selling many kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make one dollar each day. Her husband operates a motor-taxi, earning approximately US$2 per day. She is asking a loan of US$250 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Modesto Jose

texts.es: El joven Modesto está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (costrucción de una habitación), trabaja como ejecutivo de ventas en la CURACAO desde hace 3 años,  es un  joven, responsable, honesto, trabajador con alto espiritu de superación personal, vive en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, actualmente  esta estudiando 4to año en administración de Empresas  en la Univesidad  URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, a pesar que no tiene hijos se encarga del cuido de sus padres y de los gastos familiares, ya que ellos son personas de escasos recursos económicos y dependen del salario que el devenga, el es un ejemplo de hijo para todos los Nicaraguenses que aman y cuidan a sus padres,  su sueño es seguir  estudiando y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.a que en los créditos anteriores demostró capacidad y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The young Modesto is requesting financing for his third credit to invest in improving his home (building a room). He works as a sales executive in CURACAO for three years. He is young, responsible, honest and a hardworker with high spirits. He lives in the zone number 5 in Nueva Guinea, and currently he is studying in his 4th year in Business Administration in the University URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Although he does not have children, he takes care of his parents and the household expenses because they are people of limited economic resources and depend on the salary that he earns. He is a model son for all of the Nicaraguans who love and care for their parents, his dream is to continue studying and have job security to help his family. In previous loans he proved his capability and punctuality in paying his dues.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Shaiq

texts.en: Shaiq Q. has a little shop where he sells different kind of food and goods for the home. He started his business 1995. Shaiq is married and has 5 daughters. He loves his daughters and wishes to give all of them the best education he can. He is a very cheerful person, and he is always glad to meet anyone who comes into his shop. All his clients are satisfied with his service. Shaiq tries to make his assortment of food products more competitive. In the near future he dreams of expanding his business and buying more foodstuffs. Right now, however, he is requesting 1200 USD. This loan will be an important part of the growth of Shaiq’s business.

loans.use: purchase more food inventory to resell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa V. is running her own village store in Yeban Sur of Benito Soliven, Isabela.  Luisa  is already 36 years old, married to Elmer, who is a farmer. Their children are Kristian – 13 years old, already in high school and Anthonette – 7 years old, already in the elementary grade. They have a common understanding in the family and they have a common goal to become successful with their lives. 

Luisa is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000.00 for her store expansion. She hopes to purchase stocks in bulk in order to increase her daily income and satisfy her family and customers with their daily needs. Through the business, she is also able to provide her children’s daily allowances and even supported their farming needs.

loans.use: store expansion

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción S. tiene 69 años, esta soltera, tiene un hijo. Su hijo estudia y tiene 7 años. La actividad económica de Doña Concepción es la elaboración de tortillas y venta de frijoles cocidos. Hace más de 30 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que dio inicio por iniciativa propia para mantener a sus hijos. Los propósitos para su negocio son de seguir atendiendo a sus clientes y ofrecerles la excelente calidad de sus tortillas. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de materia prima como maíz y frijoles por lo que estos suben de precio y solo así podría mantener en existencia la venta de sus productos. Sus sueños son de mejorar la calidad de sus tortillas para mantener la afluencia de clientes. La cantidad solicitada por Doña Concepción es de C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 10 meses.
texts.en:
Concepcion S. is 69 years old, single, and has one son. Her son studies and is 7 years old. Ms. Concepcion's activity is producing tortillas and selling baked beans. For more than 30 years she owns this business, which she started out of her own initiative to be able to take care of her son. Her goals for this business are to keep servicing her clients and offering them the excellent quality of her tortillas. This is why she requests this working capital financing as she needs to purchase raw material like corn and beans which are constantly increasing in price. This is the only way that she will be able to keep selling her products. Her dreams are to increase the quality of her tortillas to keep her customers coming. The amount requested by Ms. Concepcion is C$4,000 cordobas over a 10 month period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, D. la comunidad D. Taccapissi, sector Quellamaya, en el distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 61 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con 05 hijos mayores. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 01 año, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado menor para engorD. (ovejas y porcinos), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra alimento para engordar su ganado (forraje y balanceado) y venderlo en la feria D. Yunguyo.  
Ella desea continuar con este negocio y requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas ovejas (para carne) para poder engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias D. Yunguyo, su deseo es ayudarse así misma y poder disfrutar su vejez, ya que sus hijos estame lejos y tienen su propia familia.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Urbano Central” [“Central Urban”], of the community of Taccapissi, Quellamaya sector, in the district of Copani, province of Yunguyo, department of Puno. She is 61 years old, married, and has 5 older children. Juliana has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year. She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of small livestock for fattening (sheep and pigs). Her first loan was of 300 PEN, an amount that she invested in the purchase of food to fatten her livestock (fodder and feed); she then sold the livestock at the Yunguyo Market. She wishes to continue in this business and requires an additional loan of 500 PEN, which she pledges to pay in 4 quotas. With the money she will be able to acquire more sheep (for meat) to be able to fatten and sell in the markets in Yunguyo. Her wish is to help herself and to be able to enjoy her old age, given that her children live far from her and have their own families.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more sheep, fatten them, and sell them.

loans.name: Djiguisèmè ("hope") Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Djiguisèmè  de l’association Dembagnouman est composé de six femmes. Elles sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au premier quartier  de la  ville de koutiala (région de Sikasso république du Mali) 
Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté et exercent  presque la même activité de vente de condiments alimentaires. (sounbala, oignon, l’ail, cube magie, et  épices) 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Djiguisèmè a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt solidaire. (Prêt de groupe) 
Ce prêt  sera utiliser pour acheter,  des condiments de toutes sortes en gros pour être revendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit,  à la maison et au marché de koutiala. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 70 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités.
texts.en:
The group Djiguisèmè of the association Dembagnouman is composed of six women who are all married. They average 35 years of age and 5 children and live in large traditional extended families in the first district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of community and kinship. They do almost the same work selling condiments: sounbala (pounded fermented seeds), onions, garlic, Maggi bouillon cubes, and spices.

In order to satisfy the needs of their every-increasing number of customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan (group loan). This loan will be used to buy condiments of all sorts in bulk to be resold retail, cash or credit accepted, at the house and at the Koutiala marketplace.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 70,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be use to make loan interest payments, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana T., 34, is married with three children.  She has had five years of experience in the ice cakes business. She sells to school children and village people, five days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 tala (~$65 US).  SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, plastic cups, cordial and chinese lollies

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario A. P. es un señor de 57 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y un ahijado  en una comunidad llamada, El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Desde hace varios meses que Don Mario  se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, el vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos. El dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

Actualmente don Mario está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto el espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
Don Mario es socio de la Asociación de Productores del Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su quinto préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mario Aray P. is a 57 year-old man. He lives with his wife and godson in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the province of Cartago. It is a small, rural community with approximately two thousand residents. Its inhabitants work in milk production and planting coffee. It has an irregular landscape and much of the land is kept as a tropical rain forest. The community has picturesque landscapes that combine the rain forest with two beautiful lagoons, coffee plantations and creameries. El Sauce is located approximately an hour and a half by bus to Turrialba, the closest commercial center. Nevertheless, a few times a year the route becomes impassable because of the rains that hit the zone. This is without doubt one of the main challenges for the community. When there weren't any activities many people chose to leave and look for work in Turrialba in the banana farms located in the Atlantic coast of Costa Rica. Currently the price of milk and coffee have improved, therefore the residents are looking for how to invest in local projects and avoid migrating. For the past few months don Mario has worked on fattening up chickens and laying hens for the production of meat and eggs. He sells his products to the community residents who are very satisfied. He says that having the support and the help of his wife helps him continue with the project. Even more he says that the project interests him since he has seen his business grow bit by bit and demand is getting stronger. Currently don Mario is asking for a micro-credit of ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy more chickens and hens, concentrate, and products for treating sicknesses, in addition to expanding and reinforcing his premises. With this he hopes to grow his business even more and improve his quality of life. He business is going well, but he hasn't been able to grow because of underfunding. With the loan that he is asking for he hopes to increase sales and thereby improve the economic condition of his family. Don Mario is a member of the Sauce Production Association, one of 100 organizational members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his fifth loan and with him EDESA hopes to continue to grow on a personal and economic level, along with actively participating in the credit organization in its community.

Translated from Spanish by Lee Bruner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens and goods

loans.name: Yo Tengo Fé Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Dulce María T. Jiménez, Darling Johana T. y Lorenzo Isabel N..

El grupo solidario Yo tengo fé, está conformado por tres señores originarias de la ciudad de Masaya de la comarca de Pacaya, grupo con excelente record crediticio, sus actividades son diversas.
Doña Dulce María tiene un pequeño negocio de Taller de costura en su casa, le vende a dueños de tramos en el mercado de Matagalpa y Masaya, su esposo es sastre y ella es modista y es por eso que decidieron trabajar en este negocio. No tienen  hijos, solo tienen dos trabajadores contratados y junto a ellos realizan la actividad.
Ella es la coordinadora del grupo porque el grupo la eligió para este ciclo, ella sueña con mejorar su casa y su taller. El crédito lo ocupó para comprar telas e hilos.

Doña Darling, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene un hijo de 12 años que va a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.

Don Lorenzo se dedica al negocio de viveros, semilleros de plantas ornamentales y frutales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, tiene clientes en los pueblos blancos donde hay clientes fijos, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio y sus dos hijos varones que además siembran granos básicos para la alimentación de la familia.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Dulce María T. Jiménez, Darling Johana T. and Lorenzo Isabel N.. The solidarity group I have faith is comprised of three entrepeneurs from the city of Masaya in the Pacaya region; the group has an excellent credit history and their activities are diverse. Mrs. Dulce María has a small sewing business in her home, she sells to owners in the markets in Matagalpa and Masaya. Her husband is a tailor and she is a dress maker which is why they decided to work in this business. They have no children, they only have two employed workers, all together they perform this activity. She is the coordinator of the group because the group chose her this cycle. She dreams of improving her home and her business. The loan will be used to buy fabrics and yarn. Mrs. Darling sells fruit, she buys it wholesale and then sells it retail during the day. She has a 12 year old son who goes to school, her husband is a trader in the same market where they carry products, this helps them with household expenses. She has been dedicated to this commercial activity since she was very young, and she believes that her business can grow and one day she can make improvements on her home. Mr. Lorenzo is dedicated to his plant nursery business, with ornamental plant and fruit seedlings. He has been in this business for many years, he has customers in white villages where there are regular clients. His wife helps with the business and his two sons also plant basic grains to feed the family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, perfumes

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cuidad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en el la Cuidad de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 35 años y 01 hijo estudiante, que aún depende de ella.

Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, nos cuenta que se inicio sembrando sus plantones de plátanos en su propia chacra.
Personalmente se encarga de cuidar sus plantones de plátanos, pero cuenta con peones que la ayudan a sembrar y cosechar sus plátanos. Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco a poco fue ahorrando, en la actualidad su chacra tiene más de doscientos plantones de plátanos, producto que en la selva se consume a diario en las familias.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprara plantones de plátanos, abono especial para mejorar el crecimiento de los plátanos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago a sus peones que la ayudan a cosechar sus plátanos, ya que mensualmente le salen de 80 a 100 racimos de plátanos. 

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar una bodega grande con abarrotes, para generar más sus ingresos y continuar aportando en la economía de su hogar.

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciarse en el trabajo que realiza y también a muchas mujeres que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Rossana belongs to the "Ciudad de los Tres Pisos" Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Lamas, in Lamas province, Department of San Martín. She is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and her son, who is in school. For many years now Rossana has made a living through farming. She tells us that she started out by planting banana trees on her own farm. Rossana personally takes charge of caring for her banana trees, but she hires agricultural workers to help her plant and harvest the bananas. She started out with 300.00 soles and gradually saved her money. Currently her farm has more than two hundred banana trees; bananas are a product that families here in the rainforest consume daily. She will use this loan of 3,000.00 soles to purchase more banana trees, along with a special fertilizer that will improve the bananas' growth. She will also invest part of the money in paying the agricultural workers who help her to harvest the bananas, since every month they pick from 80 to 100 bunches of bananas. One of Rossana's dreams and aspirations is to set up a large grocery store so that she can generate more income and continue contributing to the household income. Rossana now feels that she is a very accomplished woman who wants to achieve and make her dreams a reality. She is grateful for the help that the Manuela Ramos organization gave her in starting her business, along with the many other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing banana trees

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Rosa es casada, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
Los sueños de Rosa son ampliar su local, aumentar su negocio e hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Paloma Community Bank. Rosa is 60 and has five children. Rosa has a store in her house where she sells general groceries like vegetables, fruits, and drinks. She works every day with some help from her children. Rosa needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy rice, sugar and drinks. Rosa’s dreams are to expand her store, increase her business, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and drinks

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Carmelina es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Hacen pequeñas fiestas entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras, hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúnen cada 2 semanas.
La señora María  tiene 45 años, es casada, y tiene 6 hijos, 3 de los cuales viven con ella todavía. Todos sus hijos ya son grandes y trabajan, menos el menor que está estudiando todavía. La señora trabaja como empleada en varias casas de su comunidad, limpiando y haciendo los quehaceres domésticos.  
Lamentablemente, la Sra. Maria Carmelina tiene algunos problemas de salud, tuvo un derrame cerebral hace un tiempo y todavía está sintiendo los efectos. Sigue trabajando siempre y cuando pueda para poder sustentarse económicamente, porque su esposo no le ayuda mucho en la parte económica. Está pidiendo un préstamo de 440 para poder invertir en los materiales que necesita para poder realizar su trabajo como empleada doméstica. 
Su meta para el futuro es mejorar de salud y tener estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Carmelina is a member of the communal bank "Mujer y Fortaleza" (Woman and Strength), a group of women who live in the community of Turi, about half an hour outside of the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. They are a group of women who get along very well with each other; they spend their meetings laughing and telling jokes. They throw small parties together for occasions like Mother's Day, and they are good collaborators. They even take turns sweeping after every meeting, at the house where they meet every two weeks.

María is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children, 3 of whom still live with her. All her children are grown up and work, except for the youngest who is still studying. She works as an employee in several homes in her community, cleaning and doing domestic chores.

Unfortunately, María Carmelina has had some health problems. She had a stroke a while ago, and is still feeling its effects. She continues to work as much as she can to be able to economically sustain herself, because her husband does not financially help her much.

She is requesting a loan of $440 to invest in the materials she needs to do her job as a domestic employee. Her goal for the future is to improve her health and have economic stability for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials to work as a domestic employee

loans.name: Mery Celina

texts.es:
La señora Mery es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 03 hijos, ella pudo estudiar educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, etc.

Su deseo es poder llenar su tienda para que haya más movimiento de clientes, por lo que obtendría mas ganancias para  ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta de Manuela la puntualidad y la organización.
texts.en:
Sra. Mery is a member of the Communal Bank “30 de Agosto”, which is located in the Illave District of El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She was able to pursue a higher education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Sra. Mery operates a grocery store. Her first loan of 500 soles was used as operating capital to acquire groceries.

She is requesting another loan in the amount of 1500 soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, etc. She hopes to fill her store to encourage more customer traffic, which will result in more earnings for her to support her children. Sra. Mery likes the punctuality and organization displayed by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is married and has two children. She lives in Githurai, which is a highly populated, very busy center with many businesses. She has been in the decoration sales and beauty cosmetics business for the last 9 years and her customers include middle and low income earners.

Judy has not borrowed from other sources, and this is her first loan with KADET. She wants to add more stock for her decorations and beauty shop, but she also wants to diversify and start other businesses. She intends to open an electronics shop and also sell some clothes.

She believes that diversifying with other businesses will increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products, electronics, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz A. is from the village of San Jose in Camiguin. She is 57 years old. Luz is single. To make a living, Luz owns and  operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luz is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Eulalia Modesta

texts.es: Eulalia Modesta M. tiene la edad de 51 años. Es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos y ninguno y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy responsable, y disfruta de su trabajo ya que comparte con muchas personas. Ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para caballero, ropa para damas, cosméticos. Su mayor sueño es mantener su actividad económica ya que es el único medio de vida que ella tiene.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: Jose Roberto G. C. de 37 años de reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad,Jose vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos Edwin de 14 años, Samuel de 10 años y Sarita de 5 años de edad. Jose es un padre de familia muy responsable, actualmente el se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado municipal de ciudad arce, tiene una clientela ya estable por que cuenta con seis años de experiencia en el negocio, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio surtiendo de nuevos productos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Arian Group

texts.en:
This is Arian group. The group is made up of three members and Shaima is the group leader. These three members have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani.

Shaima is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. She embroiders in her house. Now, with the Kiva loan, she wants to buy a new sewing machine and wants to start her business in its new way to support her husband and children.

Nazia, who is the second member of Arian group, has a tailoring business. Through its income she supports her family members and her purpose of getting loan is to expand her business.

The last member is Taj Baroo who is a quilt maker.

They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jenny Giovanna

texts.es:
La socia JENNY pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de atender su pequeño negocio de venta frutas que ofrece al por mayor y menor en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de frutas.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JENNY, 26, is a member of the “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” communal bank; she is single and from the city of Cusco. She alternates her domestic chores with her work tending a small, wholesale and retail, fruit sales stand in Cusco's "Virgen Asunta" market. She needs the funds to increase her working capital in her fruit sales business. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital in fruit sales business

loans.name: Yevgen

texts.en:
Yevgen is single. He is an entrepreneur from Khoost where he sells sports and tourism equipment in one of the local malls called “Senator”. His vending location is known for good quality, durable equipment.

As tourism is quite popular in this part of the country, known for its mountains and picturesque nature, Yevgen’s merchandise is always in high demand. He has been in the trade for two years. Presently, he has 3,500 Grivnyas of monthly net profit.

Yevgen is seeking a 6,500 Grivnya loan to increase his working capital. He is hoping to become a successful businessman one day. We believe his optimism, hard work, and good potential will help him achieve his goals and succeed in his endeavors.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech E., 26, lives in SiE. Reap Province, where she earns her daily income by selling a few vegetables in the local market. She also plants a variety of crops on the land next to her house, where her husband farms with her. They have been married for a year but have no children. In the past, Pech E. has needed to pay fees to taxis to deliver her vegetables to the market for sale, and she now hopes to use a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle which she will use for her transportation needs. She will use the remainder of the loan to build her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ausner Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ausner Pérez desde hace cinco años se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa comercializada ambulantemente en las calles del departamento de Masaya siendo este negocio el que le permite obtener los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia a la que tanto ama.

A diario ofrece la ropa a sus clientes y hay días los cuales vende todo pero también hay días que no logra vender mucho y actualmente está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa, sabanas y blusas para abastecerse de ello y así continuar ofreciendo dicha ropa en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Ausner Pérez has been selling clothing for five years as a street vendor in Masaya; this is the business that enables him to obtain the income to support his family that he loves so much. Daily he offers clothing to his customer and there are days where he sells everything but also there are days were he isn’t able to sell much. Today he is seeking a loan to invest in buying clothing, sheets, and blouses to support himself and offer those items in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie E. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Jossie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fish to members of the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jossie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jossie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
