She is married and the mother of two school-aged children. She has been in her business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. 

Johnna has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional products and soft drinks to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Johnna hopes to expand her retail business and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 32 years old and lives in Ololmasani in Kilgoris area and is married to Janet.  They have three children ages six, four and two years old.

Mike has a retail shop that he has been running for the past two years.  He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a new stock of soft drinks, milk, bread and eggs for sale.  Mike is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business which will help him earn more income and help him provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, milk, bread, eggs, etc. to add to his stock.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
This lady is May, 31, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Michael, a waiter, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

May operates a little school supplies business where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, and the like, without going to a bookstore. May gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP)  in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

May dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of school supplies.

loans.name: Hanamoa

texts.en:
Hanamoa is 45 years of age and married with three children. Hanamoa owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Hanamoa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Hanamoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Hanamoa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Erdenemunkh

texts.en:
Erdenemunkh is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter on his own small sized land located in the Darkhan city of Mongolia. He is a truck farmer and cultivates vegetables in 2 plant-houses behind his house. Also he and his wife both work in a wool factory. 
Erdenemunkh uses his own grown vegetables in private needs and sells the remaining vegetables outside of his family.  This covers the most part of his income and he is planning to add another plant-house in his vegetable garden. It is a natural-oriented businesses. Therefore he is taking a loan to cover a plant-house cost. Before he had taken loans 2 times and successfully repaid them on time.

loans.use: To covers a plant-house cost.

loans.name: José Horacio

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad, José Horacio se considera un luchador, que decidió no dejarse derrotar por los problemas económicos que enfrentaba su familia, y comenzar un negocio propio para brindarle a sus 9 hijos estabilidad económica, y aunque ha sido difícil lograrlo día a día trabaja con la ilusión de ir progresando, José Horacio tiene una chaza donde vende dulces, cigarrillos, chicles y otros, a las afueras de un colegio ubicado en el municipio de Santuario del departamento de Antioquia. 

Sueña con llegar a tener un establecimiento más grande, que sea reconocido y donde pueda vender gran variedad de productos. Pero para ello necesita un préstamo con el cual pueda comenzar a cumplir este sueño, con él comprará surtido de dulces e insumos que surtan su negocio, y así continuar progresando, mejorando las ventas y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 63 years old, José Horacio considers himself to be a fighter that refused to give up when his family faced financial troubles, starting his own business to provide his nine children with financial stability.  While it has been difficult to do day to day, he works with the hope of moving forward.  José Horacio has a stand where he sells candy, cigarettes, gum and other items outside of a school located in the Municipality of Santuario in the Department of Antioquia.

He dreams of having a larger point of sale that people know and where he can sell a large variety of products.  However, he needs a loan in order to begin to fulfill this dream.  With this loan, he will purchase assorted candy and supplies to stock his business and continue progressing and improving sales, as well as his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to stock his business.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a 26-year-old young woman who is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with modest salary and he also works as a taxi driver. 

Ayat wants to share with her husband in completing the price of purchasing a new taxi, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for her share, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Ayat gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to share with her husband and purchase a new taxi. This will enable her husband to work extra hours and increase his income to provide better living conditions for the family. 

Ayat is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing new taxi.

loans.name: Rabiyuvlo

texts.ru: Рабиювло возраст 42 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и ответственный человек, он 4 года занимается куплей и продажей сухофруктов и имеет хорошую прибыль. Он также занимается куплей и продажей свежих фруктов. В бизнесе ему помогает жена. Он полученного дохода он построил дом. Рабиювло  запрашивает займ  на сумму 11000 сомони для покупки товара, полученный займ поможет развить бизнес и принесет прибыль в семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Rabiyuvlo is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He is a hard-working and responsible person, who has been involved in buying and selling dried fruits for four years and makes a good profit.  He is also involved in buying and selling fresh fruits.  Rabiyuvlo's wife helps him in this business.  He used his profits to build a house.  Rabiyuvlo is requesting a loan in the sum of 11000 somoni to buy products.  This loan will help him to develop his business and bring a profit to the family budget.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a resident of Gulcho, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 54 and is married to a welder. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and two daughters.  The daughters are employed; the older one is a bookkeeper, and the younger one is in obstetrics. Her older son works in Russia, and her younger son is a soldier. In order to earn money, Tamara breeds cattle. She has been running a cattle breeding business since 1985, with which her husband helps her. At the moment they have a cow, five calves, and six sheep. With this loan, Tamara plans to purchase four calves to increase her number of cattle. In the future, she wishes to build a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development, and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase four calves for breeding.

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él es comerciante de mariscos al mayoreo, este negocio es de familia, lleva 5 años realizándolo por su propia cuenta, logrando mantenerse y de las ventas poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos variados, pescado fresco de varias clases, curvina, guapote, boca roja, sardina, entre otras clases, para ofrecer al mayoreo, esta inversión le ayudara bastante para abastecer a los clientes que le comprar los productos.
La aspiración de José es comprar mariscos frescos, para agradar a los clientes, manteniendo su preferencia, así también velar por las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and three children.  He operates a wholesale seafood business.  It's a family business and he has been running it on his own for 5 years now.  He makes enough from the business to support his family.  
Jose is applying for a loan to buy seafood--fresh fish such as corvina, guapote, boca roja, sardines, etc.--that he will resell to commercial buyers.  This loan will allow him to stock the business with the products that his customers want.  
Jose's goals are to: stock his business with fresh fish, satisfy the demand from his customers and provide for his children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his fish-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install security grilles at the windows of her home

loans.name: Paula Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Paula es soltera pero  tiene una niña de 16 años  que se encuentra estudiando, ella sola saca adelante a su hijita,  la clienta vive en la casa de su  Padre en la zona de ciudad Satélite La cliente tiene la actividad de comercio ambulante por el centro de la ciudad (venta de variedades adornos de cocina, etc. ) con esta actividad ella corre con los gastos del hogar, con el dinero del crédito para  comprar variedad de mercadería para estas fiestas de fin de año, ya que la Sra. tiene varios pedidos de productos ya que tiene mucha clientela, ella es una persona amable y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, su deseo es el de ver a su hija profesional en un futuro sentirse orgullosa ya que  su sacrificio valió la pena.
texts.en: Mrs. Paula is single but has one 16-year-old daughter who is in school. She is the only provider for her little girl. Paula lives in her father's home in the city of Satélite. She has a stall downtown where she sells various decorations and accessories. She is able to cover her household costs thanks to this business. She will use this loan to buy a variety of merchandise for the end of the year, since she has various orders and a large customer base. She is a very kind person and is very grateful to the Institucion for this support. Her desire is to see her daughter become a professional in the future, and to be proud, because her sacrifices will have paid off.

loans.use: to buy home accessories.

loans.name: Guwa Kushinga Group

texts.en:
Arthur is 59 years old. He is married and has four children aged 39, 37, 28 and 25 years. He does not have other dependents. His wife helps him in the business.

He is a general dealer and runs a grocery shop at Guwa Town Centre. He has been in the business for three years and is doing well. He has one employee. 

He is facing challenges of buying goods at high prices and incurring high transport costs. He has a vision of expanding his business and wants to buy a car, which he will use for transporting his goods, in the next five years. 

With the profits from the business he will be able to buy food and livestock for the family.

loans.use: to buy groceries and hardware.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has five children. Her husband operates a bar. Efua works buying fresh fish from the market and then smoking them to sell at Ankwanda near Elmina. Efua uses her income to help her husband to pay school fees for their children. 

Efua is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. This will result in an increased income that she will save for the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
San Expedito se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá  gracias a que una de las miembros contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 19 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el tercer ciclo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Felicita, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de joyas, como ser cadenas, pulseras, anillos y demás. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y poder, de esa forma, estar cada vez más cerca de su meta, la cual es poder tener su local propio.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar joyas, y de esa forma poder surtirse, ya que tiene pedidos con los cuales le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
San Expedito is the name of a distinguished group of women which was formed in the city of Ita, thanks to the fact that one of the members contacted the consultant at a weekly meeting she was conducting in the area, to find out the kind of work the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras undertakes.  Once advised about the Program she was able to gather together 19 women who are currently working very comfortably together and are in their 3rd loan cycle.
 
One of the members is Señora Felicita who sells all kinds of jewelry such as chains, bracelets, rings and more. Through this work, she helps her family to get ahead and in this way can be ever closer to her goal of having her own premises.

She is asking for the loan to buy jewelry and in this way stock up as she has orders pending she would like to be able to complete.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Nafea'a

texts.en:
Nafea'a is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi Amman, Jordan, who supports two family members.

She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for materials for sewing such as fabric, beads and thread.

In the future, she wants to open a sewing factory and also she would like to buy a home.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and three children (two girls and a boy, aged 10, 8,5) in the Old City of Jerusalem. She is the household breadwinner as her husband is unemployed on modest disability benefit. She gets some income from hairdressing and beauty treatments, but their home is too small to expand this business. She has received business training from MATI, a business development foundation in Jerusalem, and has begun to import blouses on a small scale. Demand for these imports was heavy at a good price, and she now seeks working capital to expand this import business. If this is successful, she hopes to set up a boutique in the Old City where she can combine this business with her hairdressing and beauty treatments.

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: A. K. Solidarité Group

texts.fr: Le groupe A. K. SOLIDARITÉ est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Patricia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Patricia est âgée de 57 ans et vit au Bénin. Patricia est mariée à un peintre du nom de Janvier. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Patricia vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Patricia vend des tissus et des boissons depuis  vingt cinq ans à son domicile. Patricia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Patricia ensemble avec les membres du groupe A. K. SOLIDARITÉ, sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des boissons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi A. is 39 years old and lives in Gapé-Nyita, in Zio prefecture. He is married and the father of 12 children, who are all facing a hard life. The initial loan he received was for raising livestock, which in turn allows him to keep his children in school. The loan was repaid with no particular problems. He makes a good livestock farmer because he is a good manager and he works on maintaining his corral every day.

He is requesting a new loan of $500 to buy feed for his livestock. We think that once he receives financing, he can make his livestock holdings profitable but especially find his way out of poverty.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kossi âgé de 39 ans vit à Gapé- Nyita dans la préfecture du Zio. Il est marié et père de douze enfants qui sont tous en situation difficile. Son premier crédit reçu pour faire de l’élevage afin de pouvoir scolariser ses enfants fut remboursé sans aucun problème particulier. La bonne gestion et l’entretien qu’il fait chaque jour pour son enclos fait de lui un excellent éleveur.

Il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $500 pour l’achat de nourritures pour ses bêtes. Nous pensons qu’en recevant ce financement, cela va lui permettre de rentabiliser son élevage et surtout sortir de sa misère.

loans.use: To buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Qudrat

texts.en:
H. Qudrat Rustam qizi is a former refugee from Uzbekistan who fled to Varkhankend village of the Saatli district during the 1990's. She is married and has 3 children. She started her animal breeding business in the late 1990's. 

In 2005, she borrowed 700 USD from Agroinvest Credit Union and bought one milking cow. She expanded her business and used the profits to improve her living conditions. Now, she wants to borrow 550 USD to buy one more cow to expand the volume of her business.

loans.use: Wants to buy one more cow to expand her business volume

loans.name: Nghoy

texts.en:
Mrs Nghoy S. is 24 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She sells beef soup in her area. Her husband is a construction foreman. They earn nine dollars a day. They have one young child.  
Mrs Nghoy would like to purchase a motorcycle in order to transport the ingredients of the soup she makes.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport ingredients.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. A. has been a leader of her union for 3 years. She is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, and deals in fabrics. She has been in this business since 2000 and hopes to buy more stock and expand her business with the loan of $250.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for sale

loans.name: Elnare

texts.en: M. Elnare is an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Gubadli Region in the Azerbaijan - Armenian conflict territory, situated in the West of Azerbaijan. She settled with her family in Sumgait city. She is 29 years old, married with 1 child. Elnare is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro she now rents a shop. The second time she borrowed $800 and built the grocery store, expanded the area of shop and increased the food assortments. She paid the loans back on time. Now, she needs $1000 to expand her business by opening a vegetable section and buying digital scales. She eventually hopes to expand her business even further.

loans.use: to expand her business, open vegetable section and to buy digital scales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise and also to invest in new products she wants to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Mambo (hello) from 34-year Sarah M. in Dar es Salaam. She is married and has a six year child. In 1998 Sarah started a business a street vender in 1998. The business originally sold snacks, but recently she has expanded the business to sell fruit as well. She is requesting a loan to buy more produce and ingredients for her snacks. She needs you to give her the support she needs to strengthen and expand her business, asanti sana (thank you very much) for your considering awarding her a loan.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Zakhid

texts.en: Mr. Zakhid is 28 years old, married, with four children. He is a farmer who lives with his family in Saatli Town situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. In 2001, he started his business by purchasing one cow with money that he had saved up. Zakhid purchases and breeds calves, then cuts and sells them to the butcher who works in the local big market. However, the income from this business remains insufficient to cover both family and business expenditures.  To increase the profit margin from his sales, Zakhid needs investment money in order to expand his small herd. His application to Normicro Saatli branch for a $600 loan has already been approved. Eventually, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Bakery A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Dinner K.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Dinner is 40 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 12 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Dinner makes approximately UGX in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand restaurant business

Dinner is joined in her small group by Rose B., Justine N., Edith N., and Veronica Nakalema. Rose B. has a business in beauty parlor and wants to purchase more cosmetics and hair oils. Justine N. is currently operating a business in selling cold drinks and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Edith N. operates a business of fish selling and wants to add in business. Veronica N.is currently in the business of water selling and distrubution and is requesting a loan to purchase a water tank.

loans.use: To expand business and make more profits

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Uzhgorod, Ukraine with her 5 year old son. She is raising him by herself and also finds the time to run her small store selling men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing. Svetlana opened this little store just recently with the help of her sister. They invested most of the money they had in equipment, rent and paperwork that needed to be done. Svetlana didn’t have much money left over to purchase inventory to sell in her store. That is why she is requesting a loan to help buy assorted merchandise.

Svetlana is very enthusiastic and self-motivated and has a high level of energy. She manages her time really well, working long hours but always setting some time aside for her son. Svetlana would like to increase her income so she can remodel the business facility she is renting and as well as her own apartment. One of her big dreams is to become the owner of a small store facility instead of just renting one. We believe Svetlana’s assertiveness and optimism will help her translate all of these ideas into reality.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Pong

texts.en: Mrs. Pong C. is 35 years old and earns about $2 per day sewing from her house. Her husband, Mr. Thorng Sophal, is a 38-year-old electrician and earns around $2 per day. They live with two children in Deumchan Village, Phnom Penh City. Now C. is seeking a loan of $500 to purchase one new sewing machine and to buy groceries to sell in front of her house. This loan helps to improve her family’s income so she can sufficiently support study fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase one new sewing machine and to buy groceries to sell in front of her house

loans.name: Num

texts.en: Num T. is a 54 year old widow in Kampong Cham province. She runs her household for her two children still living at home while they go out to work each day. One of her daughters owns a grocery store and earns 3 US$ per day while another child is a factory employee earning 2 US$ per day. Both her younger children are devoted to supporting their mother. Her oldest daughter is married and lives away. She sends her mother what she can, usually about 30 US$ per month. Num T. wants to provide for her children by purchasing more grocery products for her daughter’s store, and helping her married daughter open up a tailoring shop. There is no social securiT. system for elderly Khmers, and family is the only support system that Num T. can count on as she enters old age. This loan will go a long way towards securing that future.

loans.use: To open up a tailoring shop and to buy grocery products for store.

loans.name: El Rincón De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
The Corner of Friends group formed when the group La Familia in the San Salvador neighborhood surpassed its maximum number of members and another group was formed. Currently this group consists of 15 members and it is in its first loan cycle. The women are involved in different activities and each one is requesting a long to invest in her business, as detailed below:

Blanca F. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Sara Díaz will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts and athletic wear.

Laura L. will invest in the purchase of apples, mandarins, oranges, melons, bananas and pears.

Viviana M. will invest in the purchase of cell phone accessories (covers, leather cases, etc.).

Verónica V. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Yeni V. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, athletic wear, noodles, rice, sugar, meats, coal, and sweet breads.

Hilaria A. will invest in the purchase of noodles, rice, sugar, meats, coal, and sweet breads.

Rosa Almirón will invest in the purchase of silver jewelry.

María L. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Rocío V. will invest in the purchase of gold and silver jewelry.

Ana E. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Digna Díaz will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sweet breads, napkins, meats, vegetables, oil and beers.

Felicia A. will invest in the purchase of hair drying creams, shampoo and conditioners.

Enriqueta Chávez will invest in the purchase of children's toys.

Guillerma O. will invest in the purchase caramels, lollipops, cookies and pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El comité El Rincón de las Amigas se dio mediante la formación del comité La Familia del barrio San Salvador, el cual se encontraba en su segunda reunión de formación y la cantidad de integrantes superó el máximo permitido por lo que se formo dos comités. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa.

Estas señoras realizan distintos tipos de actividades y cada una solicita el crédito para poder invertirlos en sus negocios y comprar:

- Blanca F. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

- Sara Díaz invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, buzos (ropa de gimnasia)

- Laura L. invertirá en la compra de manzanas, mandarinas, naranjas, melón, bananas, pera.

- Viviana M. invertirá en la compra de artículos de celulares: carcasas, estuches de cuero, de plásticos, protectores de siliconas, entre otros.

- Verónica V. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

- Yeni V. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, buzos, fideos, arroz, azúcar, carnes, carbón, panificados.

- Hilaria A. invertirá en la compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar, carnes, carbón, panificados.

- Rosa Almirón invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata.

- María L. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

- Rocío V. invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata, oro.

- Ana E. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

-Digna Díaz invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas.

- Felicia A. invertirá en la compra de secador de pelo cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores de pelo.

- Enriqueta Chávez invertirá en la compra de juguetes para niños.

- Guillerma O. invertirá en la compra de caramelos, chupetines, galletitas, alfajores, etc.

loans.use: Purchase varied merchandise / compra de mercaderías varias.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a single, 27-year-old mother of one son. Maria travels to the Ayacuchan Jungle where she sells vegetables, cereal, etc. that she acquires from the supply markets of Ayacucho. She usually buys her products on Fridays and re-sells them on Saturdays and Sundays in the city of Puerto Cocos. Furthermore, Maria sells catalog cosmetics to her friends and relatives.

Maria is a member of the Nueva Vida Village Bank. She needs a loan of 2,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in celery, carrots, various cereals, onions, and tomatoes for re-sale.

Maria's dream is to have her own grocery store and to move forward with her son.

loans.use: to invest in celery, carrots, various cereals, onions, and tomatoes

loans.name: Rukia Kulendea's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Rukia K., age 42, is widowed with three children. She has been involved in her business for 15 years. She sells vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics) door-to-door. She works from 11am to 4pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $517. She purchases her supplies in the neighboring country of Burundi, and heads there once a month to restock.

This will be Rukia’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She intends to use the loan to pay rent for a small shop in the Kimara area, where she will be able to sell the vitenge. She will share this loan with her group, Uvumilivu. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Rukia is on the far left.

loans.use: To pay rent for a small shop

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 40, is divorced and has two children, ages 10 and 15. She has been a charcoal and bites (snack) seller since 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asha is looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasind her present stock.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, a sus 40 años, es madre de dos hijos maravillosos, espera de ellos, es que estudien y sean profesionales algún día. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica, desde hace mucho tiempo, a la venta de productos de personales (hilos, papel higiénico, productos de limpieza, telas, entre otras variedades). También vende de comida por las noches y gracias a su carisma y jovialidad se ha ganado una gran gama de clientes, es por eso que ahora optó por comprar un mostrador (vitrina) y llenarla con sus productos. Es madre soltera, y dice, no necesitar, ni depender de nadie, para salir adelante. Precisa de un capital para lograr su objetivo y cumplir lo que quiere. Con tu ayuda Maria logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and she is the mother of two wonderful children. She expects them to study and grow up to be professionals one day. She is a very active woman with dreams of self-improvement. She has been selling since a long time household products (threads, bathroom tissue, cleaning products, fabrics, among other items). She also sells prepared foods in the evenings and thanks to her charisma and joviality she has earned herself a great client base. She has now decided to purchase a display case for all of her products. She is a single mother, and she says, she dreams of not needing to or having to depend on anyone to make it through. She requires capital funds to meet her goals and to accomplish what she wants. With your help Maria will be able to achieve her goals in a very short time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case to organize her products.

loans.name: Nkambo-Specioza Group

texts.en:
Specioza N. is a single, 30-year old mother of four children, aged six to thirteen. She sells used clothing on the streets in the Kitintale village of Kampala early each morning to late in the evening. Three times a week she takes public transportation to the Owino market, Kampala’s busiest wholesale exchange, to buy bales of second-hand clothes.

This is Specioza’s first loan with BRAC. She will use the proceeds to purchase bales of bulk used clothing in larger quantities to lock in a lower cost and expand her inventory for the busy festive (Holiday) buying season. She makes less than 20,000 Ush a day.

Increasing her revenue and profit are important to Specioza, as she provides the family’s only income. School fees are 300,000 Ush per term. Including books and school supplies, school cost Specioza over 1,000,000 Ush per year. Paying school fees in addition to other living costs makes it difficult to feed her children two meals in a day when sales are down.

Specioza’s dream is to educate her children to the university level, earn enough to begin a savings account, and to open her own clothing boutique to relieve the physical burden of carrying a heavy bag all day.

loans.use: Purchase bales of bulk used clothing in larger quantities

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Juana is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. She and her husband have a locksmith shop in their home; they have one employee who helps them with their work. Juana also makes homemade ice cream, which she sells from a cart on the streets around the city of Ayacucho. Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy iron rods and ingredients to make ice cream. Juana dreams of improving and outfitting her business and that her children will grow up to be working professionals. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Juana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Juana junto a su esposo tienen un taller de cerrajería que esta ubicado en su domicilio, además tiene un personal que le ayuda en los trabajos. Además Juana vende helados que ella misma prepara, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente por diferentes calles de la ciudad. Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros y insumos para helados. Juana sueña con mejorar e incrementar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy iron rods and ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia Owusu is thirty-four years old. She is divorced and has two children: a boy and a girl. Her children are both currently in school. She says her son is in the senior high school while her daughter is in the basic school. Sylvia says her ex-husband helps to cater for the children. However, the children live with her in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Sylvia runs a provision store to make some of the money needed to meet other demands of the children and herself. Her shop is located at the lorry station. She has been in business for three years now. She sells items such as tins of milo, milk, sugar, bread, and tin fish. Sylvia also trades in dresses and bags in other towns. She procures her goods from wholesalers in the big surrounding cities, such as Kumasi. She wants a loan to expand the size of her shop and also to buy goods in bulk. It is her dream to own one of the big supermarket shops in her community.

loans.use: To procure provision in bulk and expand her shop.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame  Ramata  D. est âgée de 60 ans, veuve elle vit avec ses 4 enfants au domicile de son défunt mari au quartier Secoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, très tôt elle commença à  mener des activités commerciales. Elle en a mené plusieurs mais  finit par opter pour le métier de teinturière. Initiée par l’ONG ALPHALOG, elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété nationale et internationale, non seulement elle participe à des foires et expositions nationales et internationales mais également elle est la première présidente du Centre Culturel de Ségou, Présidence qu’elle a occupé pendant plus de 10 ans. Elle jouit aussi d’une grande clientèle, diverse et variée et  reçoit de la commande de partout. 
 Dans l’optique de plus se  professionnaliser et de réagir vite aux demandes de sa clientèle, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle  est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 42 mois, après  3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 300 000FCFA. 
Ce prêt   sera  utilisé pour acheter 50 pagnes de tissus écrus, 20 sacs de kalama 5 cartons d’eau de javel et 2 cartons de savons. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place à Ségou.
Madame Ramata  D.  vend lors des expositions, foires, festivals ou au Centre Culturel Sinignesigui de Secoura. Ses ventes se réalisent   au comptant ou à crédit avec paiement d’un acompte de 50% pour les clients fidèles. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes, nationaux ou étrangers.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elle ambitionne faire le transport.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramata D., 60, is a widow and she lives with her four children in the home of her deceased husband in the Secoura neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having been able to attend school for socio-economic reasons, she began early on to work at income-generating activities. She tried several, but ended up deciding to specialize in dyeing cloth. Trained by the NGO "ALPHALOG", she has been working in this sector for 20 years and is well-known nationally and internationally. She has not only taken part in national and international fairs and exhibitions, but she is also the first president of the Cultural Center of Ségou. She has held this post for over 10 years. She also has a diverse and varied clientele and gets orders from here, there and everywhere.

With a view to becoming more professional and being able to be more responsive to orders from her clientele, she has turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been dealing with us for 42 months, and after three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all reimbursed in a timely manner, she is on her third individual loan in the amount of 300,000 F CFA.

This loan will be used to buy 50 lengths of freshly woven cloth (gray goods), 20 sacks of kalama, 5 cartons of bleach, and 2 cartons of soap. She buys her raw materials right in Ségou.

Mrs. Ramata D. sells her goods at exhibitions, fairs, festivalsand at the Sinignesigui Cultural Center of Secoura. Her sales are made on a cash basis or for credit with 50% downpayment for faithful customers. Her clientele is composed of men and women, Malians and foreigners.

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA which will be used to cover her family's current expenses. Her ambition is to go into transporting goods.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for making "bogolan" (Malian mud cloth)

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Erna engages in buy and sell of Fish/charcoal and rice. She’s in this business since 2005. She is 47 years old, married and blessed with 1 child who serves as her inspiration to pursue her goals in life. She is still hoping that she can have another child after 2 years. For now she requests a loan of P8,000 to be used as additional capital to her buy and sell of fish, charcoal, and rice. She will purchase 2 sacks of rice and 4 sacks of charcoal. The loan from ASHI is a great help for the business because she can order raw materials in a bulk at lower price.  She dreams that her business will expand and meet the needs of her customers in the village.

loans.use: as additional capital for buy and sell of rice and charcoal

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus  es una persona mayor de edad ya no la contratan en una empresa y ella se queria sentir util ayudando en los gastos de su casa y fue como decidio empezar con su negocio, vendiendo los productos al principio ayudaba a otra persona que esta directa en la compañia a repartir productos cosmeticos. 

Comenzó el negocio marzo de 1995, desde ese dia a la fecha ella se ha ido desenvolviendo muy bien en el ramo de los productos hace demostraciones cada quince dias y de esa manera obtiene mas clientes y mayor ganancia ahora ella ya es distribuidora directa de la compañia.


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para adquirir más mercancía y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientea.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus is an older woman and she can not get a job at a company because of her age. She wants to be useful and help her family with the household expenses. So she decided to start her own business at home. She sells cosmetics and she started her business in 1995. From that time on she has done very well. Every 15 days she does demonstrations of her products and this has helped her to get more customers and to sell more. She is a direct distributor for the company that she sells cosmetics for. Maria de Jesus needs a loan of $375 which she will repay in 12 payments that she will make twice a month. She will use the money to buy more merchandise and to have a better selection to fill the orders of her customers.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Chick Carlson

texts.en:
Married with one child, Calson is a member of GHAPE, one of Kiva's microfinance partners, and this loan of 70,000 CFA will be his second since joining the organization in 2007.  He and his family have faced many of life's challenges, like continuous health issues, death of loved ones, first family business failing, but with the help of Kiva and GHAPE, Calson is able to create a better life for him and his family.

Calson will use this current loan to purchase fertilizer, additional seedlings to expand his crops, transportation of his produce and pesticides.  Because some of his crops are almost ready to harvest, Calson is hopeful that his farming business will continue to do well.  In addition, because he needs additional labor to work his land, he is helping his community by creating employment opportunities for his neighbors.

With the profits of the loan, Calson will pay for his child's school fees, expand his business, and possibly create a store of cocoyams and plantains.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and for transportation costs.

loans.name: Mauilevao

texts.en:
Mauilevao A., 55, is married with no children. She has 1 year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the villagers and school 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala. SPBD loans are Mauilevao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase bagged sugar, plastic cups, paper, milk, vanilla,

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita D. T. owns a small shop. She sells spare parts. Her husband, Anito D. T., is an engine mechanic. They work very hard to support their family. Aside from having a shop, she sells coconut wine. It's a natural wine and is very popular in Bohol. Teresita is 50 years old and has 2 children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a toolkit for his business. The loan will really help her and her whole family increase their income.

CEVI provides not just loans to all their clients, they also give training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy toolkit and spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 52 años, es un padre de familia muy dedicado, vive con su única hija Mari de 22 años en su casa propia, la cual está hecha de adobe, él es muy trabajador y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Manejando su taxi, mantiene a su hija, quien todavía está estudiando en la universidad, él sabe que tiene una gran responsabilidad con ella, puesto que tiene que velar por su futuro. Lleva ya 25 años en este negocio y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios, es muy amable con sus pasajeros, le gusta conversar con ellos, lo cual hace más amenos sus viajes. A Humberto le gusta mucho su trabajo, puesto que puede recorrer libremente las calles de la ciudad de Puno, espera más adelante poder comprar un auto nuevo, para asociarlo a la empresa donde trabaja y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que trabajar las 24 horas del día, sin poder descansar muy bien, aun así sabe que tiene que continuar trabajando duro, si es que quiere mejorar su vida. Este es el primer préstamo al que accede Humberto con MFP, está decidido a ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su taxi, ya que las actuales están muy gastadas.
texts.en:
Humberto is 52 years old. He is a very dedicated family man. He lives with his only daughter Mari who is 22 years old. He lives in his own house which is made of adobe. He is a very hard worker who wants very much to get ahead. He supports his daughter by driving his taxi. She is still studying at the university. He knows he has a big responsibility since he needs to look out for her future. He has already been in this business for 25 years and he always greets his clients with a smile on his face. He is very friendly with his passengers and likes to talk with them which makes his trips more enjoyable. Humberto likes his job a lot since he can drive freely through the streets of Puno. He hopes to buy a new car in the future, sign it up with the company where he works and improve his income. The hardest part of his job is having to work 24 hours per day without resting very well. Even so, he knows he has to continue working hard if he wants to improve his life. This is the first loan Humberto has applied for with MFP. He plans on being punctual with his payments since he doesn’t want to cause any problems for his community bank. He participates actively in it and is a very dear member. He will buy new tires for his taxi with the thousand PEN he has applied for since the current ones are very worn.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his taxi

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía acaba de cumplir 40 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 4 hijos que la apoyan en su negocio. Todos los días se acuesta muy tarde debido a que tiene un negocio de venta de comida al paso, en su carretilla pone las ollas de arroz chaufa y tallarines, bien abrigadas y se ubica en la calle principal de su pueblo donde las personas acuden a deleitarse con su sazón diariamente. Por las tardes, cuando el reloj marca a las 5.00pm ya es posible encontrarla en su lugar habitual, muy contenta conversando con sus clientes, ya que es eso lo que más le gusta de su negocio.  Rosalía anhela tener un espacio en su casa destinado para su negocio y de ese modo no pasar frió, además así les brindaría mayores comodidades a sus clientes. Ya son 15 años que lleva en este negocio y cree que es hora de crecer y mejorar su calidad de vida. En los 4 préstamos anteriores consecutivos con MFP no ha tenido ningún problema con sus pagos, ya que los ha cumplido con regularidad. En su banco comunal es muy activa y se preocupa por el bienestar de sus compañeros. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de un carrito salchipapero (estructura móvil dotada de una freidora de papas y pequeña parrilla), para que venda salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas) en aras de captar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosalia recently turned 40 years old. She lives in her own home with her 4 children who help run her business. Everyday she goes to sleep very late because she works as a fast food vendor. In her cart, arroz chaufa and noodles are kept warm in pots. She sells food on the main street of her town where people take delight in her daily flavorings. In the afternoons, when the clock strikes 5pm, you can find her in her usual spot, happily making conversation with her clients. This is the part of her business that she enjoys the most.

Rosalia longs to have a space in her home for her business, to no longer have to be outside in the cold and also be able to provide additional conveniences for her clients. It has been 15 years since she has started her business and she believes it is now time to expand and improve her quality of life. She has not had a single problem repaying each of the 4 previous consecutive loans that she received from MFP and has made her payments regularly. She is very active in her village bank and cares about the well-being of her peers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a salchipapas cart (a mobile structure equipped with a chip fryer and a small grill) so she can earn a higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a food cart

loans.name: Leonarda Martina

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Chucuito, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 55 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 8 hijos, (2 dependientes aun D. ella), tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en la Comunidad D. Chinchera - Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 2 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. lana sintética.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar lanas D. diversos colores  para la producción D. artesanías en miniatura.
 
Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas D. capacitación.
texts.en:
Leonarda belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 55, married, and has eight children (two are still dependent). She has a first graD. education. She lives in the Chinchera community in the San Bartolomé sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for nearly two years. She bought synthetic wool with her first loan for 300 PEN . She now needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy diverse colors of wool to make her handicrafts in miniature. Her biggest wish is to keep working. She likes the savings and the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy synthetic wool

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en: Seuon P., age 29, works in the agriculture sector as a rice farmer, making a typical income of $1 US per day. P. and her husband work hard to ensure that they and their two young children, who are not yet old enough to be enrolled in school, can live comfortably. Her husband travels from place to place in his province selling carpets and bedroom materials. He makes approximately $5 US per day. P. wants to take out a loan of $1,000 US so that her husband can expand his business's inventory in the hopes of generating more income for her household expenses and their childrens' future education. P.'s husband is featured in this picture.

loans.use: Purchasing carpets to increase business inventory

loans.name: Wanda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Wanda de los Ángeles Rodríguez L. tiene 23 años. Es una joven muy emprendedora. Ella tiene 1 hijo y es madre soltera por lo que su mayor prioridad es el desarrollo y el buen crecimiento de su hijo. Desde muy joven se dedico a este negocio, y siempre ha trato de brindar lo mejor de su trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene clientes jóvenes. Ella tiene muchos proyectos en mente, pero siempre quiere mantener este negocio. El destino del dinero será para compra de productos como camisas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior, calzado y bolsos.
texts.en:
Wanda de los Ángeles Rodríguez L. is 23 years old. She is a very enterprising young woman. She has one son and is a single mother, so her main priority is the development and good upbringing of her child. From a very young age she has dedicated herself to this business and always tries to offer her best to her work. The economic activity that she dedicates herself to is the sale of general merchandise as her clients are young. She has many projects in mind, but always wants to keep this business. The money is destined to buy things like shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, shoes and bags.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul sells phone accessories. He is 35 years old and single. He has been in the business for four years. He is hoping for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Gudilla

texts.en:
Gudilla S. is from the village of  Mambajao in Camiguin. She is 55 years old. Gudilla is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Gudilla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Gudilla has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gudilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gudilla is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gudilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine F. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 38 years old. Josephine is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Semeurs Victorieux Plus Group

texts.fr: Joséphine  K. est dirigeante du groupe dénommé « Semeurs Victorieux Plus » composé de 29 membres. Elle vend de la friperie au marché de son quartier situé à l’est de la ville de Kinshasa. Après avoir commencé cette activité en 1980, elle a acquit une expérience solide en gestion et en marketing qui constituent des outils efficaces pour l’avancement de celle-ci. Elle est cliente très fidèle qui a bénéficié 8 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a remboursés correctement. Le prochain prêt lui permettra de diversifier son activité en achetant des poissons frais à revendre dans le but d’accroitre son capital.  Actuellement, l’affaire lui génère $50 de bénéfice par semaine. Joséphine rêve d’ouvrir un magasin d’habillement. Agée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants scolarisés, âgés de 18 et de 22 ans.
texts.en:
Joséphine K. is the leader of a group named “Semeurs Victorieux Plus”, which is composed of 29 members. She sells second-hand clothing at the market in her district located east of the city of Kinshasa. After having begun this business in 1980, she acquired solid experience in managing and marketing, which constitute effective tools for advancing it. She is a very loyal client who benefited from eight loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC, and she repaid them properly. The next loan will enable her to diversify her business by purchasing fresh fish to resell with the goal of growing her capital. Currently, her business generates $50 a week in profits. She dreams of opening a clothing store. Joséphine is 46 years old, married, and the mother of two children, who are in school. They are 18 and 22 years of age.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and to diversify her business with fish

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr:
Madame Agnès Berthé est âgée de 36 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec seulement ses 3 enfants (puisque son mari est partie en exode)  dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de  Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Madame Agnès n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, elle  s’est donc très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus plus précisément la transformation des noix de néré en sounbala (un condiment traditionnel très prisé au Mali et dans la sous région Ouest Africaine) auprès de sa maman comme d’ailleurs toutes les femmes de son  ethnie les  Minianka.  
Cette activité est très rentable car elle peut transformer 2 sacs de 100 kg de noix de néré en sounbala par semaine, ce qui  lui procure assez de revenus.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et en qualité, madame n’a pas pris du temps pour faire  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis maintenant 1 ans.  Elle  est à son deuxième   prêt  individuel, le précèdent a été correctement payé.  
Ce prêt nouveau servira à constituer un grand stock de noix de néré, au grand marché  de la ville de Koutiala, auprès des grossistes. Madame Agnès vend au comptant et en gros ses  productions de sounbala à Sikasso et souvent à Bamako,  à une clientèle composée de femmes et de revendeurs. 
 Avec l’augmentation  de sa matière première, elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiens de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agnès Berthé, 36, lives in a monogamous family, with just her three children (because her husband has gone abroad), in the Koko neighborhood of the prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Madame Agnès did not have the good fortune to go to school, so she began to work at money-earning activities early on, to be precise, at transforming 'néré' nuts into 'sounbala' (a condiment which is traditionally much prized in Mali and West Africa) together with her mother, as well as all the women of her ethnicity, the ' Minianka' people. This work is very remunerative since she can turn 2 sacks of 100 kg of 'néré' nuts into 'sounbala' every week, bringing in a good deal of income.

In order to satisfy her clientele as far as quality and quantity go, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. She is on her second individual loan, the first having been correctly reimbursed.

This new loan will serve to buy a large stock of 'néré' nuts, in the big open-air market of the town of Koutiala, from wholesalers. Madame Agnès retails and wholesales her "sounbala' in Sikasso and often in Bamako, to a clientele composed of women and of other retailers.

With the increase in her raw material, she hopes to see a monthly profit of 120,000 F CFA which she will use to repay the interest on the loan and cover the daily living expenses of her family, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 'néré' nuts

loans.name: Serapia Micaela

texts.es: La señora  Serapia B.  tiene 38 años de edad, es Casada  habita junto  a su esposo  e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio llevan 15 años de laborar en la artesanía  su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Tzansiguan de la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente, por las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra  no son suficientes para poder cubrir su necesidad, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Serapia B. Is 38 years old. She is married, and lives along with her husband and children. She and her husband do the same work. They have spent 15 years doing craftwork. Her home can be found in Caserío Tzansiguan in the town called Vásquez, in the Department and Municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, the economic conditions in which she finds herself are not sufficient to be able to cover the necessities. For this reason she has approached the Association ASDIR to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and in this way increase her sales. She also hopes to be able to carry her family forward such that they would have a better livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 59 años de edad, es casada,  tiene 03  hijos, 1 de ellos vive con ella  y 2 tienen pareja con las que viven a parte en Puno e Ilave respectivamente. Tan solo asistió transición.
Feliciana trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde ace 04 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, los cuales compra de los vecinos y los lleva a vender a Ilave.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró 2 chanchos y gallinas.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar 1 torito.
Su visión hacia el futuro es, continuar con su negocio y  seguir trabajando para tener una vejez tranquila.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los préstamos y ahorros.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (White River Breezes) community bank in Pilcuyo district of El Collao province. She is 59 years old, married, and has 3 children. 1 of her children lives with her still and the other 2 are married and live in Puno and Ilave. Being alone has helped the transition. Feliciana has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years. She buys small livestock from neighbors and sells them in Ilave. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought 2 pigs and hens. She is requesting a loan of 1,300 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of a bull. Her vision for the future is to continue her business and keep working so that she will be secure in her old age. What she likes most about her community bank are the loans and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie M.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Labinay, Ozamiz City. Elvie has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia tiene la edad de 52 años y es casada. Sus propósitos son de seguir manteniendo su clientela ya que es la fuente de ingresos necesarios con la que cuentan. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, cosméticos y calzado, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene su negocio es de 20 años, Doña Juana inicia este negocio en busca de otro trabajo que le generara ingresos para su familia  por lo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercadería, al comienzo no le fue tan difícil ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así recurre a todas sus amistades  para mostrarles los productos de venta además empezó a realizar los financiamientos con el fin de invertir más en su mercadería por lo que siempre ha trabajado con Fundación y decidió quedarse con este apoyo. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para ropa interior, perfumes, vestidos entre otros productos debido a la temporada que se acerca.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia is 52 years old and is married. Her intent is to continue to maintain her customer base as it is the fountain of necessary income on which they count. Her economic activity is the sale of general merchandise like clothes, cosmetics, and shoes. The location of her business is itinerant. She has been in this line of work for 20 years. Doña Juana began this business looking for another line of work that would generate income for her family, so she decided to sell merchandise. At the beginning, it was not very difficult for her, as she has always liked to work. She drew on all of her friendships to show them the products for sale. In addition, she began to use financing in order to invest more in her merchandise. She has always worked with Fundación and decided to stay with this support. The loan is for work capital destined for underwear, perfumes, dresses, and other products depending on which season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Saruon

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroun T. lives in Chong Kong Kor village in Takeo province. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other is a construction worker.

Mrs. Saroun T. is a farmer who owns a piece of land she uses to grow vegetables. In this plantation, she now faces some problems because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and fuel. The rest of the loan she would use to buy poles to cultivate beans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, fuel and bean poles

loans.name: Fernando Bladimir

texts.es: El Sr. Fernando G. es trabajador de la alcaldía municipal trabaja en los viveros sembrando plantas y revisando que este bien siempre todas las plantitas, el dinero lo solicita para comprar arroz, azúcar, Aceite y jabones ya que tiene en su casa una pequeña venta. Es casado su esposa atiende el negocio tiene una familia de seis hijos dos en edad escolar y los otros trabajan por su propia cuenta ha tenido dos créditos con Ceprodel siente que si le han servido de mucho ya que con estos se ha ayudado en tener su negocio y en mejorar su casa y se siente muy agradecido con Ceprodel por brindarle estos crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando G. is a worker at town hall. He plants and oversees the municipal gardens. The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oils, and soaps, as he has a small store in his home. He is married, and his wife tends to the business. He has six school-aged children, and the others work for themselves. He has had two loans with Ceprodel, and he feels these have helped him greatly to support his business and make improvements to his home. He is very thankful to Ceprodel for providing these credits.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil and soaps.
